4+ years of experience in vulnerability management
4+ years of incident detection
4+ years of InfoSec incident root cause analysis
Experience with developing software tooling to solve custom problems
 Job summary 
 Amazon Healthcare (AH) is on mission to reinvent healthcare and driving the future of medicine. We use design, service and technology to provide the best possible customer experience and change the way people think about medicine. AH is searching for a talented Security Engineer to help us evolve the technology security and risk processes that power the core pharmacy and fulfillment engines. 
 
 As a member of our Healthcare Information Security team, you will be at the heart of the healthcare planning and operations. The very foundation of the AH customer experience is Trust. Assuring trust through education, security planning, and active systems monitoring are key components. You will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally with engineering, product, clinical / distribution, and customer care teams. A Security Engineer is the go-to partner for solutions and problem solving for any security related issue. 
 
 You will be expected to deliver actionable advice and guidance across the AH environment in support of ongoing initiatives. Additionally, you will be responsible for participating in design discussions, code reviews, and communicating with stakeholders at every level within the organization. 
 
 As a Security Engineer at AH, you will help establish technical standards and drive AH’s technical architecture, engineering practices, and operations practices. You’ll work on AH’s hardest problems, building high quality, architecturally sound secure systems that are aligned with our business needs. You’ll think globally when building systems, ensuring AH builds high performing, scalable, and secure systems that fit well together. AH Security Engineers translate business needs into workable technical solutions. Your expertise is deep and broad; you are hands on, producing both detailed technical work and high-level architectural designs. 
 
 This role will be a direct report to the Security Manager participating in new strategic initiatives. It will provide opportunities to think big, be customer obsessed, and to partner with business teams across AH. We dive deep into security technologies such as new identity and authentication systems, hardware security components, cryptography, system hardening, and massive-scale audit and log analysis. The objective of the AH infosec program is to define the innovative preventative, detective, and monitoring mechanisms to enable security individually and at scale. In this role, you will discover, define, and solve challenging problems across multiple teams and locations. 
 
 Security Engineers across Amazon are expected to be strong in multiple domains and provide contributions to service, infrastructure and administrative teams. Security Engineers are expected to develop elegant solutions to complex business problems and apply appropriate technologies while following security engineering best practices. You are also expected to mentor more junior engineers and be a security thought leader for the organization. 
 


Demonstrate innovative security approaches in non-traditional IT environments
Experience with technical writing
Experience in generating automated metrics to measure IT security effectiveness and consistency.
Experience translating technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand concepts
Ability to deal with ambiguity and establish clear strategy
Information security professional certifications encouraged (SANS GIAC, CISSP,CISO, etc.)
Experience architecting, securing, and operating Amazon Web Services
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
 This position may be located in Boston, MA or Austin, TX and relocation is available. 
 
 Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

eSentire® is the global leader in Managed Detection and Response (MDR), keeping organizations safe from cyber attacks that technology alone cannot prevent. Our 24x7 Security Operations Center (SOC), staffed by elite security analysts, hunts, investigates, and responds in real-time to known and unknown threats before they become business disrupting events. 
 
 We want to cut through the hype and overblown claims surrounding AI and ML to help our customers successfully tackle their biggest challenges utilizing human expertise at machine scale. We value each person’s unique contribution, so if you love to solve difficult problems--together--eSentire is the place for you. 
 
 eSentire has been recognized in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ and Fast 500™, Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers, and Gartner’s Market Guide for Managed Detection and Response. For more information, visit www.eSentire.com and follow @eSentire. 
 
 The Security Solutions Consultant partners with eSentire customer teams both technical and non-technical to provide strategic guidance and insights aimed at the identification and mitigation of risk, resulting in continuous security program improvement. The main function of this role will be to combine security expertise and technical skills in order to engineer and drive security outcomes specific to our customer needs. This individual will work closely with the customer success organization on the development and execution of customer success plans and roadmaps. The Security Solutions Consultant will further be responsible for identifying opportunities for improving cyber resilience in our customer environments. In addition to partnering with our customers to fully understand the challenges and priorities in their environments, the Security Solutions Consultant conducts ongoing research, monitors industry and technology trends as well as trends in the broader threat landscape to facilitate the education, enablement, and overall success of our customers’ internal IT and Security teams. 
 
 Responsibilities 
 

Work with the Solutions Architecture team to align on the scope and desired outcomes of newly onboarding customers
Provide onboarding support (recommendations, best practices, etc.) for the technologies that support the delivery of eSentire services
Remain up to date and provide guidance and insights regarding industry trends and the ever-evolving threat landscape
Provide customer feedback to product and security operations teams
Drive adoption of eSentire services and platform through education and enablement
Work closely with support teams to resolve technology challenges
Deliver risk mitigation recommendations via service reviews, ad-hoc customer meetings, incident review, etc.
Establish trusted advisor status by building relationships and providing actionable insights
Obtain technical certifications as required
 Qualifications 
 

CISSP, C|EH, CISA, CISM, CCSP, Security+ or similar certification(s)
(3+) years of previous technical consulting and/or project management skills
Excellent written, verbal, and listening skills
Demonstrated technical knowledge, consultative skills, and presentation skills
Self-motivated and customer-focused, strong analytical skills and detail-oriented.
Experience in one of more of following areas: EDR, EPP, SIEM, Cloud Security, Network Security, Threat Intel, Managed Services, Security Operations

We Offer You:
 At eSentire we work in a collaborative and innovative work environment. We work with brilliant and passionate people who strive and encourage others to do their best. eSentire’s idea-rich environment welcomes creative and sometimes unconventional perspectives! 
 
 We continually create a rewarding place to work. We want you to thrive in it and contribute to it. We provide: 
 

Wonderful colleagues you’ll be proud to work with and learn from
Subsidies for professional accreditation
Annual taxable spending account specifically for your wellness, including health clubs, sports team registration fees, or fitness items (to name a few)
Competitive referral bonus up for referrals of top talent
One of the fastest growing companies in Canada with growing operations internationally
Waterloo Area's Top Employers 2022 Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers 2020
Attractive compensation plans to ensure we hire, keep and reward team members
Full benefits package including paid parental leave, a matching 401k program and medical, dental, vision and life insurance.
 At eSentire you will have the opportunity to grow and make an impact from your work. We encourage innovation in all who become part of our team. With growing operations internationally, there is lots of lateral and upward advancement opportunities for rewarding and developing careers with eSentire. We’re strong believers in continuing education and provide the resources that you need to continue learning. 
 
 We thank all applicants in advance for applying. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. 
 
 eSentire is committed to creating a fair work environment that is aligned with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). We guarantee equal treatment and provide opportunities regardless of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, status as a protected veteran or any other legally protected grounds and will not discriminate on these basis. If you have any accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please reach out to our HR team at aoda@esentire.com and any accommodation needs will be addressed upon request.

Position: Cybersecurity Consultant - Incident Response and Forensics
Description:
As the largest communications company in the world, more than 120 million customers count on us every day to deliver the wireless, Internet, data and advertising services that fuel their businesses and connect them to their world. You will find yourself connecting communications and technology with opportunities that will take you to places you never imagined.
What does it take to join us? We demand exceptional skills in your discipline and a real dedication to being the best. After all, we're asked to keep AT&T profitable and on the cutting edge, and at the same time, build on more than a century of innovation and success. We are a world leader in communications and entertainment, and we plan to keep on growing.
Overall Purpose: AT&T Security Consulting Group is seeking an expert and experienced Senior Consultant to provide Incident Response and Forensic (IRF) Trusted Advisor services to AT&T’s US and global clients. Key services include: Cybersecurity Incident and Breach Response, forensic analysis of compromised assets, malware reverse engineering, and ultimately identification and remediation of compromised assets.

   Key Roles and Responsibilities:
   

Collaborates with and provides consulting services to clients in a trusted advisor role.
Works on billable consulting service projects.
Works independently on complex projects or works in a team as a project leader.
Provides advisory assessments in relation to cybersecurity breach prevention.
Conducts gap assessments and provides actionable recommendations to remediate shortcomings.
Documents findings and recommendations in Remediation Roadmaps.
Manages aspects of delivery, customer satisfaction, and accurate timekeeping for billing purposes on projects where the consultant is the only technical resource or lead technical resource.
Participates in group discussions to further knowledge in the IRF practice and provides peer review of deliverables.



   Secondary Responsibilities:
   

In a sales support role, meeting with customers as an IRF SME in support of sales team.
Support in identifying additional sales leads on assigned projects and beyond.
Attending sales conference calls or client meetings, support in scoping and developing SOWs/proposals.

Must be a flexible team player, hard-working, and possess excellent communication and customer-facing skills.

Endpoint Support Administrator


 Join our 
community
 and experience 
Emerson College
!

 This role is responsible for the triage and resolution of all Tier 3 support requests for both macOS and Windows endpoints, as well as the design, security, and management of asset inventory and staff and faculty printing on campus. In coordination with the Mobile Device Administrator, this role will be responsible for the training of student staff on Tier 1 support, and the tracking and evaluation of service and usage metrics.
  

Your Key Responsibilities:

 Work with Windows and macOS Endpoint Administrators to test and deploy operating systems and software to College-owned endpoints, including the optimization of specialized software and ensuring functionality across multiple hardware configurations. Develop design and administrative skills in both macOS (Jamf) and Windows (WorkspaceOne) endpoint management tools.
  
 Assign, triage, and resolve Tier 3 support requests received via phone, walk-in, email, and online form. Lead communication with internal IT departments and other support departments on problem identification, escalation, and resolution. Communicate directly with Emerson students, staff, and faculty to help diagnose, troubleshoot and repair College-owned endpoints. Utilize a variety of tools to prioritize and track assignments, including our service desk software for support requests (Zendesk), our project management tracking tool (Asana), and our chat service for internal departmental support (Slack).
  
 Administer campus staff/faculty printing utility (PrinterLogic), and act as primary point of contact for support requests for additions, updates, and hardware configurations for the current printing environment. Coordinate with Tier 1 and Tier 2 support teams to address printing issues and hardware maintenance, and resolve Tier 3 support requests for the platform with manufacturers. Assist with creation and maintenance of documentation and training materials for PrinterLogic.
  
 Build and maintain asset inventory tools in collaboration with User Services and MTP leadership, including development and maintenance of asset tracking schema, and software license tracking with vendors and support teams. Serve as the primary point of contact with asset inventory developers and equipment suppliers. Responsible for campus communication regarding updates and changes to asset inventory.
  

Your Other Responsibilities:

 Work with other Tier 2 staff to lead student staff training on proper troubleshooting and resolution of Tier 1 issues. Oversee student staff training opportunities, including modeling best practices for customer service, phone support, creating documentation and guides for student staff, and being a part of in-person training and orientation meetings each semester.
  
 Work with other Tier 2 staff to review inventory and usage statistics for ticketing platform, software usage tracking, and other metrics. Analyze trends, identify areas for improvement, and work with the leadership team to implement changes to endpoint deployment, equipment utilization, and software licensing based on feedback.
  
 Perform other relevant duties as assigned.
  

Your Qualifications:


 3 to 5 years of experience as a desktop support technician or equivalent in a medium- to large-scale environment (500+ endpoints)
 1 to 3 years of experience administering systems that support endpoint computing, particularly print management
 Strong knowledge of macOS and Windows operating systems
 Experience in working with Jamf and WorkspaceOne, or equivalent systems
 Experience in administration and deployment of key endpoint technologies (Adobe, Microsoft Office, endpoint security)
 Expertise with asset management, including development and maintenance of asset schema
 Strong written, interpersonal, and verbal communication and customer service skills
 Advanced hardware and software troubleshooting skills
 Experience with ticketing and project management platforms


 You'll be preferred if you have:


 Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in a field related to this role (an associate's degree and significant relevant experience may be accepted in lieu of bachelor's degree)
 Experience in the field of higher education support
 Knowledge of usage tracking and metrics evaluation
 Interest in learning, problem solving, and new technologies


 Work Environment:


 Typical office environment
 Ability to sit for long periods
 Ability to concentrate for long periods of time
 Ability to lift up to 30 pounds

About Us
 Emerson College is the nations only four-year institution dedicated exclusively to majors in communication and the arts in a liberal arts context. Its main campus is located in the center of the dynamic multicultural city of Boston, in close proximity to major publishing houses, arts institutions, and research centers. The college also has campuses in Los Angeles and the Netherlands. Emerson College enrolls over 4,300 graduate and undergraduate students from more than 70 countries and all 50 states.
  

Diversity Statement
 Emerson College believes diversity enriches the educational experience by providing students with the opportunity to learn from individuals who may have different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Engagement with diversity in the curriculum, in our co-curricular offerings, and all other aspects of the College enhances the personal and intellectual growth of all members of our campus community. Emerson is committed to strengthening communities, including our workplace, by fostering the development of the intercultural competencies necessary for meaningful citizenship in an increasingly complex, pluralistic society. Emerson College does not discriminate on the basis of sex/gender in its educational programs or activities. Emerson has designated the Associate Vice President, Title IX, and Clery Coordinator to respond to inquiries regarding the College Sexual Misconduct Policy. Annual Clery Report
 In accordance with the federal Clery and Campus SaVE Acts, Emerson College commits to providing all current and prospective students and employees with access to the annual campus security reports for each of our campuses.  The Cyber Security Analyst is responsible for supporting the Senior Systems Administrator – Cybersecurity to assess, monitor, and execute security measures to help protect Boston Mutual from security breaches and attacks on its computer network systems. They will be responsible for monitoring, testing, maintaining, and ensuring that all technology platforms and applications are well protected and updated with the latest protections. This role will also include completing various tests, researching latest attacks, testing new software, implementing new regulations, and any other processes to ensure the networks security. The position resides in the Infrastructure and Security group, which is responsible for the management, administration, operation, and compliance of technology platforms and applications.
The Cyber Security Analyst is expected to complete all Cyber Security responsibilities which include but is not limited to:
Monitor the organization’s networks and systems to identify any violations or breaches
Monitor software and current user status to protect networks and organizational information
Carry out regular cyber security tests to simulate attacks
Installing and using software, such as firewalls and data encryption programs, to help protect the company’s data and sensitive information.
Research the latest cyber security trends and software to prevent current or upcoming threats
Develop standards and processes that promote the company’s security
Prepare and create regular cyber reports of current state and improvements needed
Interacting and training users about security threats and how they can improve security
Maintain and review current software white and black list
Maintain strict confidentiality in all aspects of staff and business information.
Qualifications
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Assurance, or Programming
Experience:
5 years' experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge Requirements:
Knowledge of Cyber security controls and frameworks.
Knowledge of information security risk management and frameworks.
Competent technical skills and solid understanding of systems management, networking, and multiple security technologies and concepts.
Critical thinker with excellent attention to detail
Demonstrated effective problem-solving skills
Excellent written communication skills with an ability to produce and maintain technical documentation.
Certifications/Licensures:
GIAC certifications preferred
CompTIA Security+ preferred
Network+ certifications preferred
The salary for this role is $80,000 - $110,000 USD.

 Description

 The Information Security Specialist is a newly created position within the bank's Enterprise Risk Management department, reporting to the VP, Information Security Manager (ISM). This position is within the Information Security function of the bank’s Risk Management Department, which provides the Second Line of Defense for Information Security assurance activities at the bank.
This individual will be primarily responsible for evaluating and testing controls within the bank’s First Line functions within Information Technology, Enterprise Information Security, and other business units to ensure alignment with the Bank’s Information Security Program, applicable regulatory and legal requirements, and overall security best practices. 
Key Responsibilities:

Perform continuous monitoring of the Bank’s “First Line of Defense” by testing information security controls to ensure controls are implemented consistently and completely.
Partner with IT and with other lines of business management to evaluate Bank compliance with the Information Security Program.
Liaise with First Line Information Technology and with Enterprise Information Security functions to understand future changes in the environment and how the Bank’s Information Security Program will apply to these future initiatives.
Access Bank applications to collect and review potentially complex data 
Compile data from the Bank’s IT and IS tools and analyze for regular reporting of control metrics 
Assist in presenting information security testing methodologies and test results in order to provide insights, conclusions, and actionable recommendations.
Track remediation efforts of observations and self-identified issues.
Assist in the development, implementation, and enforcement of bank security standards.
Support other functions within Enterprise Risk Management as an Information Security SME, including the DR/BCP function and Third Party Risk Management




Qualifications

 Qualification Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Information Security, or other related discipline
Minimum of 3 years of experience in Information Security and/or Information Technology Risk Management functions
Previous experience in Information Security at a financial institution preferred.
Proven ability to assess security controls and recommend resolutions
Working knowledge of relevant industry regulations and standards (including ISO 27001, NIST, GLBA, COBIT, and Sarbanes-Oxley)
Working knowledge of FFIEC IT Handbooks 
At least one of the following industry certifications is preferred: 
     
Certification Information Security Auditor (CISA)
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Certified in Risk and Information System Control (CRISC)

Superior communication skills to translate security recommendations into business terms for non-technical stakeholders
Proven ability to work both independently and with cross-functional teams
Ability to assess information security risk and to communicate risk to relevant stakeholders 
Ability to manipulate data in Excel preferred.




Our goal is to offer our colleagues the most generous benefits package possible. We strive to provide colleagues with a comprehensive benefits package and an environment that supports a healthy work-life balance. Benefits include: Competitive compensation with performance incentive awards, Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, a 401K and DC Plan for your retirement, LTD & Life Insurance, Day Care Reimbursement, Tuition Assistance for graduate and undergraduate programs, an award winning Wellness program and much more! 
At Rockland Trust you'll find a respectful and inclusive environment where everyone is given the chance to succeed. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Company: Exec Office of Technology Services and Security
Description:
The MA Executive Office of Technology Services and Security (EOTSS) is the state’s lead office for information technology. We provide enterprise level information technology services including network management and security; computer operations; application hosting; desktop provisioning and management; and modern and responsive digital services to 40,000 internal stakeholders plus the residents, business owners and visitors to the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
The MA Executive Office of Technology Services and Security (EOTSS) is seeking to hire a Major Incident Manager to join our IT Service Management Office. This role will own the Major Incident process for a 24/7 operation. This requires tight integration with Service Desk, functional resolver groups, IT executives and ITIL processes. The role will also be responsible for Problem Management and incident and problem trend analysis. The incumbent will need to have a strong understanding of user impact in a complex environment and the ability to quickly assess what IT functions may be needed for the timely resolution of any major incident. The Major Incident Manager reports directly to the Director of I.T. Service Management and will be a peer of the Service Desk Manager.
The primary work location for this role will be at 200 Arlington Street Chelsea, Massachusetts 02150. The work schedule for this position is Monday thru Friday, 8AM to 4PM EST. This position would be expected to follow a hybrid model of reporting to work that combines in-office workdays and work from home days as needed. Participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation with the ability to work after-hours or weekends to accommodate operational business needs.
All offers of employment into this position are conditional and subject to passing: a Massachusetts Criminal Background Check (CORI); a security clearance (fingerprinting) consistent with IRS and/or public safety requirements; and security training.
Position Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

Responsible for the design, documentation, implementation and management of the Major Incident Management and Problem Management processes
Lead the Major Incident team through mentoring and feedback to continually improve the processes
Manage and participate in the 24/7 on-call and standby rotation schedule
Act as escalation point for team
Direct activities and establish command and control during Major incidents
Coordinate and drive all activities during the incident on the incident bridge
Provide frequent updates to incident bridge participants
Ensure Executive status updates are provided during recovery activities
Perform regular reporting of all major incidents
Oversee post incident review meetings through to root cause
Ensure that event details are gathered and appropriately documented to support post incident reviews, Problem Management, and root-cause analysis as well as to provide necessary communications to Executive and customer teams
Complete, track and archive all Major Incident and post-incident reports
Perform regular reviews of active, historical incidents and root cause analysis to identify trends and opportunities for improvements across the IT functions
Partner with Service Desk manager to proactively review the daily queue stats and tickets to pro-actively identify potential chronic issues which may deter future major incidents and improve the customer experience
Lead the audit of the Major Incident and Problem Management processes to support Continual Service Improvement
Work with customers to understand their business. In conjunction with the customer, identify the critical applications and services.
Conduct awareness campaigns and training on the Major Incident and Problem Management processes
Additional duties as needed or assigned

Preferred Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

5+ years of extensive experience working on IT support, major incidents and problem management in a complex IT support environment.
2+ years of hands-on experience with leading resolution of major incidents in a complex IT environment.
At least 2+ years of experience in completing after action review and root cause analysis documentation
Proficient knowledge and hands-on experience with the ServiceNow Platform.
Employs a structured approach to questioning and adopts a logical troubleshooting methodology to manage and coordinate multiple tasks within tight deadlines.
Has the ability to, and is comfortable with, taking charge of high-pressure situations, such as conference calls and customer meetings, at all levels of management.
Action-oriented with the ability to balance urgency with sound judgement.
Ability to pro-actively work and drive major escalation faults, projects and tasks within all areas of the business and external third parties.
Must be a self-motivated individual with the ability to work with minimal supervision.
Possesses an excellent level of written and verbal communication skills, including written communications, presentations, and would be able to represent the Service Management organization in a customer facing (internal and external) situation in a professional manner.
Strong interpersonal communication and collaboration skills and the ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of employees and leaders at various levels.
Demonstrates customer focus and understands the importance of exceeding customer expectations.
Demonstrates the ability to contribute to the team’s overall output, actively contributes in team meetings and providing constructive feedback.

Education and Certifications:

Associates Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field, or equivalent work experience.
ITIL V3/V4 Foundation Certification




Qualifications

 First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.  Please see Preferred Qualifications.

Details relating to demonstrating compliance with this requirement will be provided to applicants selected for employment. Position: Compliance, Information Security, and Privacy Specialist
Description:
Compliance, Information Security, and Privacy Specialist

Compliance at C Space is a fast paced, challenging and engaging environment where no two days are the same. We do business with established household names across the globe, and to do that we handle a variety of international laws, regulations, and codes of conduct. You’ll interact with every discipline and client across the business to put Compliance, Information Security, and Privacy first, with a personable manner and can-do attitude. You’ll learn about what it means to be a customer agency in a changing regulatory landscape and will collaborate across global departments and wider disciplines to solve complex and rewarding problems.

As our Compliance, Information Security, and Privacy Specialist, you will be a key member of the Global Compliance and Information Security team responsible for C Space’s global compliance, privacy, and information security programs. You will collaborate closely with other Compliance team members, Finance, Sales, Technology, and Consulting teams, as well as other internal and external stakeholders.


In this role
Along with bringing your full self to work, you will facilitate and aid the Compliance and Information Security Department with the everyday running of the business. Including the following:

Facilitate vendor (3rd party) management (TPM) and respond to client security reviews / audits.
Review and update SOWs, manage Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) and assist with the Media Release process, regarding gaining explicit consent from community members.
Manage concurrent workflows with internal stakeholders, answer questions from the Consultancy side of the business and track compliance and security training progress across the company.
Be an advocate for all company compliance, privacy and information security related issues.
Work with key business groups to update policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of the company's data and systems.
Assist team members during incident response, investigations, and reporting.
Assist and conduct internal and external risk assessments (RA) to validate compliance and manage risks regarding protection of data CIA.
Oversee, processes and implement strategies to mitigate prioritized risks discovered in the RA process.
Manage external compliance, privacy, security assessments and coordinate with the appropriate entities or authorities as required.
Review contracts and assist in the review of compliance, privacy, and security negotiation during the contracting phase.
Build and maintain relationships with client contacts, including drug safety and quality departments.

What you’ll bring
Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a compliance, privacy, risk management or information security role.
Experience in developing, reviewing, and implementing relevant policies and procedures and programmes that meet compliance, privacy, and information security requirements.
You’ll have working knowledge and understanding of relevant regulations and standards such as baseline working knowledge of one or more of the following: GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, SOX, SOC2 Type II, MA 201 CMR 17, ISO/IEC 27001/2 and NIST.
You may already have one of the following desired qualifications: CISSP, CISA, CIPP, CIPP/E, CPIM, CIPP/US, CIPP/A.
Knowledge of information security processes such as Change Management, SSDLC, DRP, BCP, IRP, SIRT.
Excellent analytical skills and demonstrated experience in communicating effectively in written and spoken form to broad internal and external entities.
Keen ability to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, with exceptional attention to detail.
Self-starter and able to work both independently and in a team setting.
A positive attitude, strong work ethic and a focus on creative problem-solving.
Proficiency in MS Office with emphasis on Outlook, Word and Excel.

Interested? We look forward to receiving applications from people with diverse backgrounds – talented, creative people with their own voice, ideas and perspectives.

In 2021, C Space has won awards for Best Career Growth and Best CEOs for Women by Comparably. Comparably Awards are provided yearly to top performing company cultures based on real feedback from our employees.


About C Space


Our clients call us their customer agency.

We create rapid insight and business change, putting customers at the heart of companies and solving problems from the customer’s perspective. We keep our clients relevant by building real, ongoing relationships with customers that in turn help them deliver superior experiences, launch successful products and build loyalty. Our customized approaches are tailored to specific business needs and include online insight communities, immersive storytelling, data and analytics, activation events, innovation projects and business consulting. We do this for many of the world’s best-known brands – like Bose, Walmart, Jaguar Land Rover, Mars, Samsung, IKEA and more – to create “Customer Inspired Growth”.


We are passionate about our people and proud of our culture. We co-created a set of values to ensure that we are delivering fantastic work, continuing to learn and developing and building a high-performance culture which creates opportunities for those who work here:


I’ve got this: taking the initiative; doing what we say we will
Only accept awesome: taking pride in your work; creating value for our clients and company
Show the love: being kind to others; taking care of yourself too
Do what scares you: challenging ourselves, taking risks and embracing opportunities for personal growth
Tell it like it is: caring enough about people and the work to provide meaningful feedback; speaking up when you have a different perspective
Open up and listen: embracing feedback from others; working hard to understand different points of view
Find what fascinates: being relentlessly curious; having a learning mindset
We before me: remembering we succeed or fail as a team
Leave your mark: driving results through your work; shaping our culture

C Space is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at C Space without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law.

C Space is a part of the Brand Consulting Group, a division of Omnicom Group Inc. We are headquartered in Boston, with offices in London, New York and San Francisco. To learn more, visit www.cspace.com or follow us on Twitter @CSpaceGlobal and Instagram @c_spaceglobal.

Come Join Our Passionate Team! At Barracuda, we make the world a safer place. We believe every business deserves access to cloud-enabled, enterprise-grade security solutions that are easy to buy, deploy, and use. We protect email, networks, data and applications with innovative solutions that grow and adapt with our customers’ journey. More than 220,000 organizations worldwide trust Barracuda to protect them — in ways they may not even know they are at risk — so they can focus on taking their business to the next level. Barracuda MSP is on the cutting edge of data security, delivering an exceptional customer experience for its channel partners. Serving over 2000 partners, and nearly 40,000 small businesses, Barracuda MSP is helping to ensure that no small business goes out of business from data loss.
We know a diverse workforce adds to our collective value and strength as an organization. Barracuda Networks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to equal employment opportunity and equitable compensation regardless of race, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability.
Envision yourself at Barracuda:

The Cybersecurity Analyst will support the timely delivery of SKOUT CYBERSECURITY services for our customer base. This includes security alarm analysis, troubleshooting and resolution of security incidents, and customer management. The cyber security analyst works among a skilled SOC team to address security matters across SKOUT customer base. This role supports 24x7x365 operations, including evening, night, weekend, and holiday shifts.

What you’ll be working on:

Perform daily operation of monitoring networks for security events/incidents to detect active threats, intrusions, and/or compromises.
Respond to security alarms and analyze and escalate incidents by process or management.
Engage on incident management and response efforts.
Perform internal and external vulnerability assessments.
Management of Endpoint Protection and Email Protection services.
Tier one support of SIEM engineering.
First line of operational support for requests with SKOUT's security services.
Support general inquiries/requests relevant to security concerns and recommendations.
Responsible for understanding the ever changing global threat landscape and tracking changes in this area, as well as understanding the direct or indirect impact to the customer base by publishing threat advisories on a regular basis.
Perform customer management by understanding, identifying, and mitigating issues with customers security.
Monitor, troubleshoot, escalate and/or remediate system health matters.
Tier one support for firewall and mail filtering requests.
What you bring to the role:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience troubleshooting in a technical environment,
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Proficiency with ticketing systems.
Customer service skills, phone and remote support experience.
Ability to work night, weekend, and holiday shifts.
Must be a quick learner.
Working knowledge of Windows or Linux systems.
Experience with basic networking principles.
Experience with incident response and analysis of attack vectors such as:
Ransomware
Business Email Compromise
Phishing
Botnet
DDoS
SQL Injection
Mobile Threats
Experience with common SOC tools such as:
SIEM
SOAR
Other Log/Packet Analysis applications
Threat Intelligence
Vulnerability Scanner
Sandbox Environments
EDR
Email Security
What you’ll get from us:
A team where you can voice your opinion, make an impact, and where you and your experience are valued. Internal mobility – there are opportunities for cross training and the ability to attain your next career step within Barracuda.
High-quality health benefits
Retirement Plan with employer match
Career-growth opportunities
Flexible Time Off and Paid Time Off benefits

Collaborate with all areas of IT to implement security policies and standards within the applications and infrastructure environment.
Manage the development and delivery of IT security standards, best practices, architecture and systems to ensure information system security across the enterprise.
Analyze and recommend secure technical solutions for network connections to individuals, vendors and business partners.
Recommends security enhancements and purchases.
Ensures that VPN, WIFI and firewall solutions are optimized from a security perspective.
Creating, testing and implementing network disaster recovery plans.
Manages operational tasks on one or more access control or network and endpoint security system.
Proactively identifies and escalates incidents and operational performance concerns.
Monitors network security management system, analyzes events to identify standard information security incidents.
Triages inbound incidents from partner teams, performs investigative tasks of varying complexity on specific incidents.
Analyzes data security risk.
Documents standard operating procedures.
Establishes system controls by developing framework for controls and levels of access; recommending improvements.
Establishes computer and terminal physical security by developing standards, policies, and procedures; coordinating with facilities security; recommending improvements.
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
3-5 years experience
Understanding of security policies and procedures
Ability to implement measures to prevent security attacks
Technical knowledge of hardware and software security components
Implementation of systems to prevent security attacks and breaches of PHI.

Position: Client Security Architect - New England Enterprise
Description:
At Optiv, we’re on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. We’re one of the fastest-growing companies in a truly essential industry. Join us.
   


 Who we are looking for:



 The Client Security Architect (CSA) plays a critical role in serving as a trusted partner to Optiv’s clients. By combining business and security practitioner knowledge, the Client Security Architect designs security solutions using some of the most advanced security services and technologies to achieve highly defensible and scalable security programs to align with the clients’ security initiatives.
   



     The Client Security Architect has real-world experience and can design pragmatic security solutions tailored to each client’s unique environment. It is a challenging yet rewarding role that differentiates Optiv from the competition.
   



How you'll make an impact:

 Effectively work with multiple client personas across the executive branch (CxO), as well as other relevant personas to develop security strategy and define roadmaps to execute on security strategy aligned business goals, budgetary spend, and metrics based on return of investment Understand the Optiv security taxonomy and clearly articulate how the various elements of the applicable Optiv solution portfolio meet the specific needs of the client stakeholders Design and solution complete security programs to meet client objectives, that includes technology and services Interface and partner with the internal Optiv teams particularly service delivery liaisons to align client expectations with the entire Optiv solution portfolio to ensure service delivery excellence and client satisfaction Meet quarterly and annual quota objectives working in partnership with the sales team using Optiv sales operating processes by adding value throughout the entire sales motion with such activities as: Facilitating new discussions by leveraging peer and industry network contacts Telling the Optiv story as the market leading security solutions integration provider Performing requirements analysis and qualification of opportunities Leading solution development efforts in security technology offerings using the applicable Optiv security taxonomy Coordinating demonstrations and security technology evaluations Seamlessly transitioning engagements for delivery to the services organization Working with Optiv’s Focused Partners to drive strategic initiatives and Go To Market strategies Maintain advisory relationships with key stakeholders at clients by providing thought leadership, support, information, and guidance in conjunction with sales partners Stay abreast of industry trends and news in order to provide thought leadership, support, analysis and guidance to clients and internal Optiv groups. Align with internal security and solutions communities for internal initiatives Support marketing to build Optiv brand awareness through speaking at corporate sponsored events, writing industry articles and leveraging social media to properly represent Optiv. Actively pursue personal development by maintaining and obtaining technical capabilities, soft skills and security specific knowledge through formal education, certification and other avenues.





Qualifications for success:

 Progress towards an industry standard cert or relevant academic experience Advisory experience across multiple information security domains Ability to listen and communicate effectively with senior business executives and facilitate high-level business discussions Qualify and prescribe implementation services for client need and review Statements of Work (SOWs) against those services Thorough understanding of the current threat landscape, vulnerabilities, defensive controls and the ability to advise clients on security technology recommendations, including review of security technology quotes against those recommendations Ability to work in a highly adaptable and nimble team environment with responsive communication Strong presentation, written, and oral communication skills to clients, including whiteboard sessions and other presentation mechanisms Highly motivated self-starter that does not require day-to-day management. Ability to work remotely with distributed teams in a decentralized environment Work with automated methods and tools to ensure client requests are fielded Valid driver’s license or other valid government accepted identification Ability to travel within assigned region or assigned accounts, as well as internationally as needed Perform additional duties as directed or needed #LI-CH1





With Optiv you can expect:



 A company committed to championing Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion through our Affinity groups including, Black Employee Network, Disabled Employee Network, Latino Employee Network, Optiv Pride (LGBTQIA+), Veterans Support Network, and Women's Network.
Work/life balance. We offer “Recharge” a flexible, time-off program that encourages eligible employees to take the time they need to recharge 
Professional training resources, including tuition reimbursement
Creative problem-solving and the ability to tackle unique, complex projects
Volunteer Opportunities. “Optiv Chips In” encourages employees to volunteer and engage with their teams and communities. 
The ability and technology necessary to productively work remote/from home (where applicable)



 If you are seeking a culture that supports growth, fosters success, and moves the industry forward, find your place at Optiv! As a market-leading provider of cyber security solutions, Optiv has the most comprehensive ecosystem of security products and partners to deliver unparalleled services. Our rich and successful history with our clients is based on trust, serving more than 12,000 clients of varying sizes and industries, including commercial, government, and education. We have the proven expertise to plan, build, and run successful security programs across Risk Management, Cyber Digital Transformation, Threat Management, Security Operations - Managed Services, and Identity and Data Management.
   


 Optiv is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, status as an individual with a disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:
 Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. 
If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients. 
Empower the Individual Through Crypto 
Our client is a crypto exchange and custodian that allows customers to buy, sell, store, and earn more than 30 cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, bitcoin cash, ether, litecoin, and Zcash. Our client is a New York trust company that is subject to the capital reserve requirements, cybersecurity requirements, and banking compliance standards set forth by the New York State Department of Financial Services and the New York Banking Law. Our client was founded in 2014 by twin brothers Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss to empower the individual through crypto. 
Crypto is about giving you greater choice, independence, and opportunity. We are here to help you on your journey. We build crypto products that are simple, elegant, and secure. Whether you are an individual or an institution, we want to help you buy, sell, and store your bitcoin and cryptocurrency. Crypto is not just a technology, it's a movement. 
Engineering Opportunities 
Our client is regulated and licensed like a bank, but it’s run like a tech startup, and engineering is the core of the company. There’s a wide range of tough problems to solve – from properly securing hundreds of millions of dollars worth of customer funds, to developing innovative new blockchain products, to finding new techniques to combat fraud, to shaving microseconds off our API response times, and everything in between. 
All of our client's engineers are able to work across the software platform, not just on their own specialization or subteam. We value a thoughtful, collaborative software development process, coupled with a pragmatic approach to problem solving and delivering software. 


The Role: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety
 As an engineer on our client's backend team, you’ll architect and solve complex problems that will directly influence the direction of the digital asset space. There’s a wide range of problems to solve at our client – from properly securing millions of dollars worth of customer funds, to developing innovative new blockchain products, to shaving microseconds off our API response times. Our client has a strong culture of code reviews, and a focus on security, with the end goal of writing and shipping high-quality code by getting things right the first time. They want to continue building the best product they can as they scale and grow their business. If you get excited about solving technical challenges that directly impact their customers, clients, and the rest of our clients' team, we’d love to hear from you. This role can be based in any of our clients' New York, Chicago, San Francisco, or Portland, Oregon offices as well as remotely in the United States. 



Responsibilities

 Develop new products and product features on our client's platform, as part of a tight knit team of two to eight developers. 
Write automated tests and work with their QA team to ensure the operation and correctness of new product features. 
Provide technical input and knowledge to the planning, design, and requirements process for new products and features. 
Review other software engineers’ code for correctness, style, and information security concerns. 
Improve the performance, maintainability, and operations of our clients' code base by engaging in occasional refactoring and upgrade projects. 
Support your team’s production software by responding to an occasional alert or bug report. 



Qualifications

 At least 6 years of software engineering experience. 
Advanced proficiency in at least one language. Our client uses mostly Scala, Java and C++ on their backend and Typescript on the frontend – it’s great if you’re comfortable in those or if you’re willing to learn. 
The ability to work closely across teams and manage dependencies. 
A customer- and product-focused mindset, with the ability to make well-reasoned tradeoffs between speed and quality. 
The ability to adapt and handle multiple competing priorities in collaboration with peers. 



Preferred Qualifications

 Experience working with fraud detection and ML systems. 
Work experience or knowledge of the finance industry, payments, trading and/or exchange systems

Competitive Compensation and Profit-Sharing Equity

Statistical Geneticists, Computational Biologists / Bioinformaticians, Data Scientists
The Massachusetts Veterans Epidemiology Research and Information Center (MAVERIC) at VA Boston Healthcare System (VABHS) is seeking talented statistical geneticists,
computational biologists/bioinformaticians, and data scientists.
MVP (Million Veterans Program) has enrolled over 875,000 Veterans and is the largest trans-ethnic biobank worldwide. Data currently available for research in MVP includes 660,000 individuals with access genomics data, electronic medical records and multiple questionnaires. MVP is developing a sub-set with multi-omics such as whole-genome sequencing, DNA-methylation, metabolomics and proteomics (pilot stage).
VA-CAUSAL is a collaboration between the VA and the CausaLab at the Harvard T.H. School of Public Health aim to develop and apply causal inference methods on epidemiological studies using electronic health records, genetics and randomized trials.
Centralized Interactive Phenomics Resource (CIPHER) is a catalog and knowledge-sharing platform of VA EHR phenotype-based algorithms, definitions, and metadata. It is also used as a tool for storing and sharing phenotype methods and resources among the VA research community. CIPHER is directly supported via MVP and will be an integral part of the VA-CAUSAL program.
MAVERIC is an independent research organization within the Veterans Administration, we offer a start-up research-driven atmosphere with the resources of the federal government. Applicants for employment with MAVERIC must be U.S. citizens and can expect to be subject to a background check. Please send inquiries through Indeed.com

Position: Data Science Analyst, Advanced Analytics - Full Time (Summer...
Description:
Join a team of scientists, analysts, product managers, and engineers leveraging ML and economic models to delight customers, grow the marketplace opportunity for suppliers, and unlock profit improvement for Wayfair. You will do this by improving our customer experience, shipping items quickly and economically to our customer, and providing compelling performance improvement recommendations to suppliers. Your software products will be responsible for creating the Cost and Profit estimates that power all of our customer touchpoints, from Marketing, Sort and Recommendations, to Pricing in one of the fastest growing e-commerce marketplaces in the world. You will leverage continuous experimentation, a modern tech stack, best-in-class modeling approaches, and economic theory to build a scalable, dynamic, and flexible platform.

We are looking for a highly motivated and solution-oriented Data Science Analyst to join our Product Analytics team. The team leverages Wayfair’s huge datasets to inform the roadmap of our pricing strategy. We work in close collaboration with a high performing team of engineers, machine learning engineers/data scientists/economists, and product managers who are on the leading edge of the product pricing space.

What You Will Do

Run open-ended exploratory data analysis and lightweight modeling to identify new ideas and opportunities
Proactively monitor our cost and profitability models to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve issues.
Build new tools that allow us to assess product performance.
Perform simulations and experimentations to prove out efficacy of data product/feature enhancements
Work closely and build productive relationships with our product, engineering, machine learning, and economist partners.


What You Will Need

Master’s degree earned by date of hire, preferably in a quantitative discipline (computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics)
Proficiency with SQL and in a structured programming language such as Python/R (aggregate functions, query optimization, stored procedures, string parsing, Vertica/Hive/Presto/Spark, etc.)


 About Wayfair Inc.
 Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.
 No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Mediahub is a global media planning and buying company with over 900 employees worldwide. We are an award-winning agency built for challenger brands – those disrupting the status quo and looking to reinvent how to reach consumers and measure success. Our smart and nimble team consists of key verticals including Insights + Action (Comms), P3 (Search, Paid Social & Programmatic), and our creative media group, the R+D (Radical + Disruptive) Lab, which specializes in working with avant-garde media partners to develop ideas that consumers seek out, share and talk about.

As one of the three major Interpublic media agencies (NYSE: IPG), we are powered by the buying and intelligence power of Magna Global and the data and tech backbone of Kinesso. We're proud to have been named Adweek's 2018 U.S. Media Agency of the Year and Ad Age's 2019 and 2020 Media Agency of the Year.

Our mission? To be an agency that attracts, retains, and promotes outstanding employees of all backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities while fostering an accepting, antiracist culture and atmosphere where all employees can do their best work and feel safe, fulfilled and appreciated. We hope you will join us!

Position Overview

The Analyst role supports AA Managers, Associate Director and Directors. An Analyst should be able to build statistical/mathematical models with guidance, and should be interested in learning new modeling techiques. A successful candidate will be someone who thrives in a dynamic, fast paced setting and to able to provide high-quality analytical skills under tight, constantly shifting deadlines.

Responsibilities
Work efficiently with clients and internal teams to define, extract, and synthesize available data and share results and insight with Mediahub team members.
Maintain and improve existing predictive models to evaluate media efficacy and effectiveness, willing to develop new models to help answer business questions.
Glean actionable insights to support in-market campaign optimization.
Perform statistical analysis of primary and syndicated research, media spend and allocation, and business

performance data.

Support proactive "what-if" analysis and guide marketing and advertising decision-making.
Analyze scenarios to assess the before/after impacts of target market selection, media choice and

allocation on client's business performance.

Collaborate and partner with other agency departments - Media, Brand Planning, PR/Social Influence,

Creative, and User Experience - in the pursuit of data-driven insights and strategies.


Qualifications
Education: Master's degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Business, Marketing Analytics, or other quantitative discipline strongly preferred.
Experience: 2-4 years of work experience (plus master's degree) in a professional services environment: management consulting, market research, advertising, statistical modeling, or interactive/technology consulting.
Proficient in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Tableau.
Advanced knowledge of one of these statistical software packages: SAS/R/Python.
Ability to build mathematical/statistical models up to medium complexity with appropriate guidance.
Ability to work with analysts in model development and application of statistical methods.
Solid understanding of generalized linear regression, direct/ digital marketing test designs, and audience segmentation.
Ability to translate insights from marketing activities into actionable business recommendations
Ability to establish and build effective relationships within and outside the organization.
Attention to detail and time management to deliver high quality work for multiple projects across several

client engagements while meeting deadlines.

Strong desire to learn new modeling techniques to help answer business questions.

 At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we hire talented people and give them the autonomy and support needed to build amazing technology and products.  The Team 
 You will be part of a rapidly growing organization, joining the team of highly motivated and professional Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers within the S&P Global Market Intelligence Data Science Team. 
 
 The Impact 
 Market Intelligence provides financial and industry data, research, news and analytics to investment professionals, government agencies, corporations, and universities worldwide. Rapid7 is looking for a curious, resourceful and motivated data science intern to solve security problems. You will be on a team of security data scientists working to apply data analysis and machine learning techniques to improve security features and make the product more impactful. You will also collaborate with members of other teams, from security to software development, to take projects from concept to production. Your project may be the foundation for a new security detection, or help a user proactively improve their security posture, or provide timely and relevant context to an incident responder.

 Responsibilities


 Work with members of the data science team to construct research project plans
 Collaborate with stakeholders to evaluate impact and viability of projects
 Get, clean, and understand the data available for a project, and explain its origin, transformations and notable characteristics
 Use appropriate data analysis / machine learning techniques to explore the viability of a project and communicate your findings
 Collaborate with engineering teams to turn viable projects into proofs of concept and productionalize projects
 Work with customers to get and iterate on feedback of PoCs


 Requirements

 In pursuit of a Bachelor's or Master's degree candidate in Computer Science, Information Security, Data Science or related technical field (min. GPA of 3.0) with prior technical internship or data science experience.
 Experience using Python, and ideally experience with pandas and jupyter notebooks to manipulate data and draw insights from large, diverse data sets.
 Familiarity with command line tools
 Experience with AWS (Sagemaker in particular) and using command line tools are a plus though not required
 Experience creating and using at least one of the following advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, classification, clustering, decision trees, recommender systems etc.
 Experience visualizing/presenting data
 Must be a fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality and data analysis
 Must have excellent communication & interpersonal skills, utilizing data to tell a story, clearly showing out the results of your analysis are relevant to the audience
 Self-motivated and accountable; able to take direction and manage prioritization of work
 Results-oriented and collaborative; able to work independently as well as part of a team

About the Opportunity
  


    Northeastern University is advancing its next generation of experiential learning. Through the development of a dynamic, personalized experiential learning engine that ensures learning experiences that are guided towards employability, we aim to equip all university learners (inclusive of both for-credit and non-credit settings) with a differentiated and integrative learning experience no matter their learning path, modality, or location.
  

    To execute on this vision, we seek a seasoned data scientist who will be responsible for conducting labor market research, modeling complex problems, and discovering insights through the use of advanced statistical, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques in order to contribute to the selection of market relevant learning products and high quality learning experiences with meaningful outcomes – for both the learner as well as our network of partners.
  

    This team member will be part of a multidisciplinary team and will be called upon to interpret data, trends, and algorithms for broad audiences, communicate with multiple stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making, and play a key role in the development of data rich features.

We're united by a mission: to make the world a safer place. Corvus Insurance uses novel data and artificial intelligence/machine learning to achieve better insights into commercial insurance risk. Our software empowers brokers and policyholders to better predict and prevent complex claims through data-driven tools and Smart Commercial Insurance® policies. This allows us to reduce or eliminate the impact of adverse events, creating a safer world for everyone. Drawing inspiration from the intelligent, tool-building corvid family of birds, we are a team of high-flying collaborative builders. We're excited to meet you. Spread your wings, and soar with us.
Looking for a company that embraces new technology, including machine learning? Corvus Insurance is looking for a talented Associate Data Scientist to join our Data Science team. We are a dynamic team of entrepreneurial professionals with backgrounds in insurance and technology creating a commercial insurance company that combines the latest technology with traditional insurance. You will be instrumental in building systems that identify and analyze actionable data for our users to consume.

Responsibilities
You will build Statistical and Machine Learning products to support new insurance products
You will collaborate with other Data Scientists and Engineers to improve our existing risk assessment models
You will identify, ingest and cleanse innovative sources of data to support existing products, including but not limited to cybersecurity data
You will perform statistical analysis to support internal decision making
You will build Data Science features into our user facing software products
You will work close with engineers to deploy and monitor Data Science Products
Qualifications
2+ Years of experience as a Data Scientist or similar role
Experience with Python, R or other similar scripting languages
Expertise with SQL or other database querying language required
Ability to critically evaluate and remediate data quality issues
You are curious and able to adapt to different domains
Insurance industry experience nice to have
Experience with AWS stack a plus
Our Commitment

So however you identify and whatever background you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day. DATA SCIENTIST, Resource Development, to play a leading role in providing analysis to inform and advance MIT's fundraising mission. Job Requirements

PREFERRED: experience in higher education advancement services, particularly fundraising business processes, prospect management, and gift accounting within a large research university setting; interest in process documentation, investigative analysis, and process review with an eye toward efficiency; interest in learning new technologies; and comfort mapping business activities to IT systems/services. Company

The mission of Well (https://www.well.co/) is to transform healthcare through our unique impact to our members' health and happiness. We do this through our differentiated consumer experience and world-class data and analytics engine that drive engagement and behavior change. Our product - a consumer health engagement platform - integrates concierge services, behavioral health, telemedicine, care management and wellness services to drive sustained engagement, lower costs and improve the health of members. In addition to our product, we know our team makes us unique. We're a highly diverse and engaged organization whose employees are passionate about the mission of the company and whose management is passionate about the employees.

Note that all new hires at Well are required to adhere to the COVID Vaccination Requirement Policy.

Reporting To

Senior Director of Data Science and Machine Learning

Position Summary

The overall goal is to engage our members to drive better health outcomes. Our analytics group (the Health Engine) contributes directly to our product through careful curation of data, analysis, visualization, and presentations. The next member of our team will drive projects from beginning to end: frame business questions, collect and analyze data, research, complete analyses, and share insights. They will work collaboratively within a team aiming to make a positive impact on the organization and on our members overall health.

Responsibilities

Structure data to deliver meaningful reporting, dashboards, effective metrics, and visualizations in support of operational performance and strategic objectives. Help improve our data-driven decision making by contributing to data management, data governance, and democratize insights across the organization.

Fulfill ad-hoc reporting requests, maintain recurring reporting needs, identify sources of data and apply transformations to create datasets for easy consumption. Additionally, create and provide training and formal documentation of delivered outputs.

Leverage and utilize a wide range of disparate data sources across healthcare (member, payor, employer, provider, partner). Apply an understanding of healthcare data and analyze large longitudinal health datasets.
Develop and contribute to our data and analytical ecosystem working to enhance intelligence and develop insights that drive business decisions.
Act as an analytical expert within the team and across the organization.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field.
Demonstrated experience producing visualizations and dashboards using Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, or other visualization tools. Tableau Certification is preferred.
Proficiency with SQL and databases.
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to communicate technical analyses to non-technical audiences via intuitive user interfaces and clean visualizations.

We embrace diversity and are committed to building an inclusive team.

Statistical Geneticists, Computational Biologists / Bioinformaticians, Data Scientists
The Massachusetts Veterans Epidemiology Research and Information Center (MAVERIC) at VA Boston Healthcare System (VABHS) is seeking talented statistical geneticists,
computational biologists/bioinformaticians, and data scientists.
MVP (Million Veterans Program) has enrolled over 875,000 Veterans and is the largest trans-ethnic biobank worldwide. Data currently available for research in MVP includes 660,000 individuals with access genomics data, electronic medical records and multiple questionnaires. MVP is developing a sub-set with multi-omics such as whole-genome sequencing, DNA-methylation, metabolomics and proteomics (pilot stage).
VA-CAUSAL is a collaboration between the VA and the CausaLab at the Harvard T.H. School of Public Health aim to develop and apply causal inference methods on epidemiological studies using electronic health records, genetics and randomized trials.
Centralized Interactive Phenomics Resource (CIPHER) is a catalog and knowledge-sharing platform of VA EHR phenotype-based algorithms, definitions, and metadata. It is also used as a tool for storing and sharing phenotype methods and resources among the VA research community. CIPHER is directly supported via MVP and will be an integral part of the VA-CAUSAL program.
MAVERIC is an independent research organization within the Veterans Administration, we offer a start-up research-driven atmosphere with the resources of the federal government. Applicants for employment with MAVERIC must be U.S. citizens and can expect to be subject to a background check. Please send inquiries through Indeed.com
