     Dept of Accountable Care and Clinical Integration
    


Job Posting Description

     You’ll be joining a team focused on the implementation of innovative pediatric payment models and clinical integration to measurably improve the care of our patients and the experience of the providers who care for them. We work with Boston Children’s Hospital (BCH), the Physicians Organizations (PO), the Pediatric Physicians Organization at Children’s (PPOC), and other primary care partners. Our ultimate goal is to develop, launch, and formalize integration and shared clinical programming in order to optimize clinical outcomes for the children we serve.
     

This Healthcare Data Analyst will be responsible for:

 Working with the DACCI, (Department of Accountable Care and Clinical Integration), analytic team, management, and key business contacts in the development and delivery of analyses and standardized reports by gathering requirements, analyzing data, and presenting the data in a logical manner.
 Providing data and analytic support for aggregation of healthcare data into information to support departmental needs related to the negotiation, implementation and ongoing maintenance of healthcare contracts with respect to risk and other alternative payment arrangements, population health management, and clinically integrated care.
 Functioning independently within a fast-paced environment, and collaborating with clinical and administrative staff to ensure that analyses and reports are timely, accurate, meaningful, and interpretable.

 To qualify, you must have:

 1-2 years of experience working with tools to access data and conduct and maintain analyses and reports or a related advanced degree
 Working knowledge of claims data and risk arrangement methodology is preferred.

Overview:

Make an impact at Analysis Group, where we provide our clients with thoughtful, pragmatic solutions to their most challenging business and litigation problems. Analysis Group is one of the largest international economics consulting firms, with more than 1,000 professionals across 14 offices in North America, Europe, and Asia. Since 1981, we have provided expertise in economics, finance, health care analytics, and strategy to top law firms, Fortune Global 500 companies, and government agencies worldwide. Our internal experts, together with our network of affiliated experts from academia, industry, and government, offer our clients exceptional breadth and depth of expertise.
As a member of the Marketing & Business Development team, the Marketing Data Analyst works in a collaborative environment with all marketing subdivisions (digital, editorial, graphics, business development, BD research) as well as the events team, administrative team, IT, and senior professional staff. The Marketing Data Analyst ensures that our CRM data quality is accurate, complete, and current; and maintains and promotes the use of Analysis Group’s CRM system, currently InterAction. The Marketing Data Analyst also assists in the development of our direct marketing mailing lists, the tracking of email engagement metrics, and the maintenance of our experience and affiliates databases.
Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities:
Develop tailored list strategies for direct marketing campaigns; manage list generation and cleansing; develop standard import/export templates; import/export lists for Marketing and end users; ensure mailing lists are kept up-to-date
Improve CRM data quality: Update contact records; manage bounce backs from outgoing mail projects; monitor and merge duplicate contacts with accurate data; apply appropriate practice area, specialization and industry tags; ensure contacts are associated with their respective firm/company; standardize firm/company names and addresses; and populate necessary data fields
Develop queries to facilitate customized data searches and reports, and analyze data to facilitate decision-making in conjunction with the company’s business needs
Review data change management tickets in CRM
Monitor CRM mailbox and support end users with questions and reporting needs
Ensure that consultants and administrators are contributing contacts, vetting lists as appropriate, adding contacts to appropriate lists, and keeping data accurate to confirm that mailings are complete and correct
Work with Marketing Data Manager and other Digital Marketing team members to produce email metrics reports and maintain comprehensive records of direct marketing activities.
Support the maintenance of data for our affiliates database, working with the Senior Marketing Data Coordinator to ensure that records are kept up to date on all affiliates, and supporting consultants and other staff on their use of the database
Collaborate with the BD Research team to support data projects such as our client litigation alert process
Support all data processes for the annual holiday card project, including working with senior consultants and administrative staff on list review, working with the Events team to coordinate gifts, and managing communication on timelines and deliverables with involved parties
Work with the IT and CRM managers to troubleshoot user issues in a daily support capacity
Assist with other digital marketing data activities as needed
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required. Degree in Business, Marketing, Market Research or a related field is desired.
2 years of substantive relevant experience required.
An ideal candidate will have 2-4 years of experience.
Prior experience in a professional services environment preferred.
Excellent data manipulation skills, especially within CRM databases and Excel
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with colleagues, both verbally and through written communication.
Strong attention to detail required.
Training, or experience in data systems, data analysis desired
Proficiency with a CRM system required. Prior use of InterAction or other CRM system in a professional services or B2B environment preferred.
Understanding of direct marketing, as well as mailing list production and quality desired
An inclusive and growth-oriented mindset, strong interpersonal skills, and an ability to work across differences.
Eligible candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship or restriction, now and in the future.
Analysis Group embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a deep and meaningful way. We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We provide equal opportunities across all sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions, races, colors, ethnicities, mental and physical abilities and characteristics, ages, socioeconomic statuses, and religions, and we encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

The primary role of this position is to support the Director of Evaluation and other UTEC program managers across departments broadly in ensuring that robust, equitable, and meaningful data and reports about UTEC programming operations and core program outcomes are accessible in a timely and accurate fashion.
Background on UTEC, INC.:
UTEC’s promise is to ignite and nurture the ambition of our most disengaged youth to trade violence and poverty for social and economic success. UTEC’s outcomes-focused model begins with intensive street outreach, reaching proven high-risk youth “where they’re at.” UTEC engages youth in workforce development and educational programs and provides intensive case management. Social justice and civic engagement are embedded in all programming. For more info, please visit www.utecinc.org.
Serving young adults throughout Merrimack Valley (Lowell, Lawrence and Haverhill), UTEC was founded in 1999 as a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping young adults (ages 17-25) overcome the very real challenges of poverty, gang involvement, unemployment. UTEC reaches 500+ youth annually through an evidence-based model aimed at reducing recidivism while increasing education and employment attainment.
Duties/Responsibilities:

Support UTEC in organizing and transforming information into comprehensible structures
Use data mining to extract information from data sets to identify correlations and patterns
Assist in the preparation and presentation of reports to program leaders and external partners
Conduct regular data audits to ensure that data is high quality, and facilitate data transfer between internal and external systems
Communicate regularly with program managers from multiple departments and, as appropriate, external partners to understand data content and business requirements with an emphasis on ensuring that UTEC’s data collection and reporting are equitable and reflect UTEC’s core values
Responsible for entering information into partner database systems (SSYI CRM) to ensure UTEC data is being accurately accounted for
Ability to manage up to Director of Evaluation and leadership team regarding data analysis
Managing data, including creation and updates
Managing all users and roles in the data system
Processing confidential data and information in a secure manner
Support in implementation of new or upgraded software systems as needed
Guide and train team members in the development of new report automation

Required Skills/Abilities:

Strong analytic skills, including mathematics and basic statistics
Proficiency with Excel and Google docs required
Strong attention to detail
Strong organizational and time management skills
Strong effective written and verbal communication
Prior experience developing or using tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats (e.g. data dashboards)
Prior experience performing routine statistical analyses of data
Familiarity with CRM systems a plus, especially a familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and/or Quick base
Familiarity with data reporting for state or federal contacts is preferred

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's preferred, or at least 1-2 years of relevant work experience
Experience working with data from vulnerable populations requiring additional sensitivity and security in data collection is a plus
Previous work, volunteer or lived experience with principles of community-engaged research and/or data collection to ensure that community members from historically vulnerable communities have ownership and representation in how data is collected is a plus.

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Comfortable with the physical demands of ordinary data entry, including manual entry and cleaning of data fields as required

Salary/Benefits: Salary range of $45,000- $65,000 commensurate with experience. Please see www.utecinc.org/jobs for more details.

We are a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for our clients through a highly diversified range of actively-managed products. We are truly global, supporting our individual and institutional investors across a range of products, encompassing equities, fixed income, multi-asset and alternatives. Our high-energy and collaborative culture at Janus Henderson helps our client achieve their goals and ensures that our people love the place they work.
   



    The department 
   

    The Technology department plays a crucial role in supporting the success of Janus Henderson. We are responsible for developing, implementing and supporting state-of-the-art software to support our fund management, trading, distribution and operational areas and for maintaining a stable and resilient IT infrastructure platform.
   



    The Global Technology department has 400+ employees, running numerous change projects across all areas of the firm, including vendor implementations, regulatory change, in-house development, as well as overseeing change delivery from third party suppliers.
   



    The Investment, Trading & Compliance Technology team is responsible for providing the best solutions and newest innovations to the globally located trading desks and fund managers. The team work very closely with the business and third parties and have a strong relationship and respected reputation for delivering change. Change is either delivered through major initiative funded projects or through the Front Office Scrum.
   



    Overview of the role
   

    Within this role, your main responsibility will be to evaluate and capture the needs and wants of our global front office business partners (portfolio managers, traders, compliance analysts and their respective support functions) and implement them within the technical/systems ecosystem at JHI in a forward-thinking manner that balances near term concerns/tactical solutions with the longer term/strategic direction of Investments, Trading and Compliance Technology. You will run regular reporting with global senior stakeholders. You will help identify strategic impacts of any cross-team dependencies and escalate where necessary. Core impacted teams being in UK, US, Singapore and Australia. At JHI, outsourcing forms the basis for the Global Operating Model and therefore this role will require engagement and management of Third-Party Administrators to successfully deliver change.
   



    Duties and responsibilities
   

    You will: 
   

Work with portfolio managers, traders, compliance officers and their support staff to understand, capture, refine and implement workflows within the team scrums.
Keep up to date with changes reflected in internal and vendor software. Identify where new functionality could be usefully implemented and offer efficiencies in the Front Office.
Always work with the big picture in mind.
Collaborate with wider technology teams to coordinate inter dependencies and resolve issues.
Work with data teams to ensure investment professionals are presented with accurate security master, trading, execution, commission, position and lot level data.
Participate fully in all scrum ceremonies. Take full responsibility for solution delivery. This includes facilitating meetings, running white board sessions, obtaining signoff of acceptance criteria and managing implementation through the guarantee period.
Contribute to the maintenance of issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates.
Produce quality test strategies and lead all aspects of system and user acceptance testing.
You will work closely with Product Owners to ensure: 
     
Any risks / issues are highlighted and mitigation options are worked through. 
Reporting of progress is clear and concise, ensuring deliverables and timelines are adhered to.

Carry out additional duties as assigned.




    Technical skills and qualifications
   

CRD CRIMS 20r+ experience.
Strong working history with Equity Traders, PM’s, Compliance, and Operations.
In depth understanding of the full lifecycle of trades.
Be time sensitive of your own, and the trader’s / PM’s time for all interactions.
Experience working with Manager Workbench, Trade Blotters, Modelling, Portfolio Management, Compliance, Order Management, Trading and Execution Management systems including expertise with multiple modules of the Charles River Investment Management System, Version 20r+.
Experience of the analysis process including: requirements gathering in form of user stories, writing acceptance criteria / test cases, implementation, capturing sign offs and presenting demos to business.
Ability to analyse high-level requirements and translate these into overall detailed system-level designs to be used for architectural design, cost / benefit analysis, and solution development.
Understand and document process maps using tools such as Visio.
Knowledge of financial products used in asset management including, Equities, Cash, Fixed Income and Complex Swap instruments. Have experience of implementing change across mentioned instrument types.
Experience of Flextrade, TSOX, EMX.
IMC certification advantageous but not essential.
SQL proficiency sufficient to analyse data and investigate stored procedures written in Transact SQL.
Understanding of messaging technologies used for the communication of transactional data to 3rd party vendor applications.
Understand change delivery within the asset management sector.
Agile experience is highly favourable.
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence.





    Competencies required
   

    In addition to putting clients first, acting like an owner, and succeeding as a team, the competencies for this role include: 
   

A good teammate - collegiate approach to work circulating important information and contributing to team discussion.
Problem solving/analysis – understanding of complex issues and problems, ability to distill them into useful components and able to identify practical, pragmatic solutions.
Self-motivated with an enthusiastic approach – a completer-finisher able to work on own initiative with a focus on ownership to resolution.
Ability to communicate, present, influence, reason and demonstrate the ability to articulate information technology concepts to non-technology personnel in a clear and compelling manner.
Ability to deliver on full workloads and exceed high expectations while remaining focused and organised in a fast-paced environment.





    Ongoing competence in the role to be assessed, in line with applicable regulatory requirements, by:
   

Annual performance appraisal.
Completion of all assigned compliance training.





    Compliance requirements 
   

    At a minimum the role will require you to: 
   

Place the interest of Janus Henderson’s Clients first, act in accordance with TCF (Treating Customers Fairly) principles.
Understand and follow laws and regulations applicable for your role, seeking the help of your supervising manager or Compliance if additional guidance is required. 
Understand and abide by all Janus Henderson policies applicable to your role, and seek support/guidance of the policy owner guidance when required. 
You are ultimately accountable for your actions and responsible for seeking further information on any or all of the above as necessary.




    Compensation Information
   

    The base salary range for this position is $165,000 - $175,000. This range is estimated for this role. Actual pay may be different

POSITION SUMMARY:

Boston Medical Center Health System is a $2.6B integrated health system devoted to the proposition that every person regardless of their social or economic circumstances deserves the best health care. Our mission is to provide Exceptional Care, Without Exception and our vision is to make Boston the healthiest urban population in the world.


Our health system includes:

Boston Medical Center, a 498-bed academic medical center and the leading safety-net hospital in New England
Boston HealthNet, a network of 15 community health centers throughout Boston
BMC Health Plan, a Medicaid managed care health plan that serves over 400,000 members across Massachusetts and New Hampshire
Boston Accountable Care Organization, a partnership between BMC and local CHCs created to coordinate delivery of care across our health network
Boston Medical Center's Pharmacy department is one of the largest and most clinically advanced pharmacy programs in the US, comprising of:

A large retail pharmacy network with about ~2.0M prescriptions filled per year
A specialty pharmacy program that is one of the largest and most clinically advanced in the country, serving tens of thousands of patients with exceptional specialty pharmacy care
An organization directly serving the BMC HealthNet Plan across Massachusetts and New Hampshire
And a clinical program that is grounded on disciplined recruitment, exceptional service, reliable retention and alignment with total health system strategy
Pharmacy analytics plays a key role in helping the Pharmacy department succeed across the enterprise. The ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data is critical to growing our business, proactively identifying trends, setting expectations through KPIs, and most importantly taking care of our patients. We are enabled by a robust hospital analytics infrastructure consisting of data from numerous sources both inside and outside of Pharmacy. The maturity of our abilities allows us to develop our own technology platforms and open opportunities for our system to access drugs and payors typically restricted to other health systems.

We are looking for team members who have the expertise to create efficiencies within our current operations (automated reports, data science, and innovative solutions for ad hoc reporting as some examples). An analyst within our team should have the ability to deeply understand the data pulled and work with business owners to create a stronger analytics engine. These analytics connect patients in need to life-saving therapies and enable one of the best programs in the country to continue to grow.

On a day to day basis, the analyst will perform data pulls, create dashboards to help track operational efficiencies, quality check data for accuracy, collaborate and refine reports with the finance function, support ad hoc reporting and more. On a longitudinal basis the analyst will help develop new tools, conduct periodic programmatic analysis (e.g. quarterly opportunity updates), and produce larger ad hoc analyses (e.g. to evaluate a new product offering ROI, etc.).

JOB DESCRIPTION


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Key Responsibilities :

Develop analyses that help the organization understand and monitor performance, break down key drivers, and identify new opportunities
Create ongoing reports and high-impact dashboards and visuals that effectively communicate performance to operational and clinical leaders and stakeholders (e.g, Tableau dashboards)
Acts as pharmacy data Subject Matter Expert (SME) responsible for understanding the pharmacy data living in systems throughout BMC
Understand the legal issues regarding participation in specific pharmacy service agreements including 340b patient eligibility
Query databases to provide Pharmacy stakeholders with key information to manage their operations
Designs and maintains databases of financial and clinical data for pharmacy programs for program evaluations, competitor comparisons, and responses to request for proposals

Works with person responsible for contract for Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program to conduct vendor monitoring, data validation, and reporting
Collaborate extensively with Finance, Analytics, IT, and business leads to deliver on organizational goals
Manage multiple projects and analyses simultaneously while meeting key deadlines and deliverables, and prioritizing time and resources
Identify and elevate key obstacles for intervention that may jeopardize timelines

(The above statements in this job description are intended to depict the general nature and level of work assigned to the employee(s) in this job. The above is not intended to represent an exhaustive list of accountable duties and responsibilities required).

JOB REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION:

Bachelor's degree, preference for concentration in economics, biology, biostatistics, data science, statistics, or computer science; Masters degree preferred.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED:

None.

EXPERIENCE:

Two to three years of data analytics experience working with large data sets to answer important clinical, operational, or business questions; prior experience with healthcare or pharmacy data a plus.
Ability to conduct advanced analytics using SQL; fluent in Excel. Knowledge of healthcare claims, pharmacy, and/or EMR data a plus. Proficiency with other scripting languages, e.g. R, SAS, Python a plus.
Experience with retail pharmacy systems such as RX30 and QS/1 preferred.
Experience with CRM / cloud data systems such as Salesforce preferred

Position: Stroke Data Analyst - Comprehensive Stroke Center
Description:
Company Description
   It takes a lot of very smart, hard-working and talented people to provide the level of care that we give to our patients. Tufts Medical Center is an internationally respected academic medical center and we pride ourselves not only on the sophistication of the care we deliver, but the compassionate way in which we provide it. And that starts with our employees.



  Job Description
   GENERAL SUMMARY:
 The Stroke Data Analyst (SDA) is a key member of the team running the Comprehensive Stroke Center (CSC) at Tufts Medical Center, a 415 bed tertiary care, academic medical center in downtown Boston, MA providing care for more than 1000 patients with stroke each year. The SDA is an expert in data tracking for clinical performance metrics, database management, data visualization, data analysis to facilitate process improvement, external reporting, and certification. The SDA reports to and works in partnership with the Medical Director of the CSC and the Stroke Advanced Practice Nurse to guide the care processes of the CSC
 PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

 Maintain and improve a concurrent database tracking the clinical care of hospitalized patients with acute stroke, monitoring achievement of core performance measures and areas identified for process improvement, and informing the Stroke APN and clinical teams of missing actions
 Maintain and improve a database evaluating clinical performance during Stroke Codes with time tracking and including patients eligible for intravenous fibrinolysis and/or endovascular therapy in order to guide process improvement.
 Maintain and improve an adverse event database to identify and facilitate clinical review of selected adverse events among hospitalized patients with acute stroke to help guide process improvement.
 Maintain high fidelity in data representation of clinical care performance for external reporting agencies including the Joint Commission, Get with the Guidelines, Coverdell/Department of Health, Center for Medicare/Medicaid Services, and others, working with data abstractors, the Quality department, administrators, and clinicians to reconcile these data with the concurrent database.
 Facilitate external reporting of clinical care performance measures to the Joint Commission, Get with the Guidelines, Coverdell/Department of Health, etc.
 Periodically audit patient charts (select number per month) to assess adequacy of clinical documentation practices.
 Prepare weekly reports of stroke case numbers and current performance for high priority quality assurance/process improvement initiatives, and other scheduled, defined reports as requested by the Medical Director of the CSC.
 Maintain and improve a core performance metric dashboard, and present this data at monthly meetings of the multidisciplinary Stroke Council.
 Analyze databases and summary reports, identify trends in clinical performance, and perform statistical analyses and data visualizations to help understand the magnitude and potential factors influencing these trends.
 Perform “drill down” investigations when clinical or process measures are not met to identify potential factors influencing these trends.
 Facilitate case updates for allied clinicians including Emergency Medical Services, referring physicians at community hospitals, and clinical care teams at Tufts MC.
 Coordinate and facilitate maintenance of Joint Commission certification of the Comprehensive Stroke Center along with the Stroke APN and Medical Director of the CSC, including preparing presentations on data use and clinical performance metrics.
 Track annual education requirements for CSC clinicians to help facilitate Joint Commission maintenance of certification.





  Qualifications
   JOB REQUIREMENTS:
 JOB KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

 Knowledge of statistics and research methodologies.
 Knowledge of relational databases, report writing, and software packages for database management and presentations.
 Experience with SAS, R, or other similar statistical software.
 Ability to present complex data and concepts to clinicians.
 Analytical skills needed to work independently with databases, perform appropriate statistical analyses, and develop data visualizations to inform quality assurance and process improvement activities.
 Interpersonal skills needed to interact effectively with clinicians including physicians, nurses, and others in an academic medical center.
 Working understanding of quality assurance and process improvement methodologies preferred

 EDUCATION:

 Masters degree or equivalent in a clinical discipline, statistics/biostatistics, data science, or science

 EXPERIENCE:

 Three or more years of experience working in health care or a health care-related field in a position requiring database management preferred
 Prior experience interfacing with regulatory agencies such as the Joint Commission, Department of Health, etc., in the certification of clinical programs or hospitals preferred


 Additional Information
   All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES STATEMENT:
 Must be able to perform all essential functions of this position with reasonable accommodation if disabled.
 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed, as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Tufts Medical Center reserves the right to modify position duties at any time, to reflect process improvements and business necessity.
 COVID-19 POLICY:
 Please note that effective October 1, 2021, as a condition of employment at Tufts Medical Center, all employees and new hires must have received their complete dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, unless they have been granted an exemption.

Point32Health is currently seeking highly motivated individuals to join their Provider Network Analytics Team in the role of Data Analyst. A key role in the Corporate Date Analytics (CDA) organization, the Data Analyst will use analytic tools and processes to unlock the value of data and deliver insight on business performance. These insights will support business critical decisions and ultimately enterprise strategic business objectives.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will provide analytic support to the Commercial, Senior Products, and Public Plans Provider Network analysis. The analytical work involves various reporting to the State and Federal agencies that require such reporting on a regular and/or ad-hoc basis. The Data Analyst will work closely with other departments within Point32Health e.g., compliance and various contracting areas to collect information and resolve any data and/or gap issues to ensure Point32Health is meeting the regulatory standards in place. This will also require working directly with the vendor to ensure that there are no data issues, and the results are correct. In addition, the Data Analyst will provide ongoing support for Provider utilization against the networks for all New England states and partners.

The role will also be responsible for other re-occurring reporting that is done to support contract managers in all three divisions. The position will also be required to support contract negotiations and work directly with Contract Managers to produce financial modeling in support of contract negotiations. The position requires the ability to translate complex contractual reimbursement terms into an easily understandable and articulate format.
Essential functions occur simultaneously and sometimes with very short turn-around time. Therefore, the employee must be able to appropriately handle each essential function, prioritize and seek assistance when necessary. These functions need to be performed on a consistent and regular basis, using good judgment.

Requirements


Demonstrate strong business problem comprehension, by developing analytic use cases (Who? What? Why?) that accurately capture business needs
Use programming and analytical skills to address analytic use cases, applying statistics where appropriate
Appropriately apply visualization best practices and data storytelling techniques
Apply a high level of QA rigor, proactively leveraging external validation sources and peer review
Develop documentation and methodologies for analyses and deliverables
Deliver a clear and concise presentation of findings to business owners and peers, tailoring the presentation to the audience
Monitor business adoption and utilization of analytic output, and solicit business feedback
Demonstrate problem solving aptitude through critique of analytic methodologies and studies completed by peers and third parties
Exemplify the characteristics of a lifelong learner, consistently seeking additional training and build knowledge/experience of business acumen, tools, languages and data sources
Act as a Lean Thinker, applying continuous improvement philosophies and approaches to identify and address inefficiencies in your day-to-day work
Meets assigned timelines and escalates risks/barriers as needed
Perform other duties as assigned

Minimum Requirements


Bachelors degree in an analytics related field with 3-5 years of experience, preferably in a payer/provider setting
Passion for data and problem-solving
Moderate to complex analytics experience required
Applied statistical experience required
Visualization best practices and data storytelling methods required
Intermediate programming skills (e.g. SAS, SQL, R, Python) required
Tableau or similar data visualization tool development experience preferred
Experience with health insurance claims data preferred
Demonstrated ability to manage tasks independently, take ownership of responsibilities and meet deadlines
Strong written and oral communication skills

Data Analyst I - (3192776)
  




 GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT:

The NeuroValue Lab is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to provide analytic support for research activities within the Department of Neurology, Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH). The MGH NeuroValue lab focuses on health services and outcomes research, specifically assessing the economic burden associated with neurological conditions. The lab was created to increase the value of healthcare in neurology with respect to the ratio of quality and/or outcomes to cost (https://neurovalue.mgh.harvard.edu/). 
Reporting to Dr. Lidia Moura, M.D., M.P.H., Director MGH NeuroValue, the Data Analyst will contribute largely to the analytical components of ongoing studies.These studies will produce generalizable, publishable findings. Specifically, the Data Analyst will work with a team of investigators, clinical research coordinators and analysts on various clinical studies and quality improvement projects. The Data Analyst will be responsible for translating research questions into analytic plans; analyzing clinical data, conducting valid statistical tests and statistical models; and assisting with data visualization and communicating findings in presentations and manuscripts. 
We are looking for someone with training in biostatistics, epidemiology, statistics, or a related field. Analytical experience using Electronic Health Record (EHR) data, longitudinal data, and advanced clinical statistical models is preferred. Specific tasks will include: database management, data extraction, data cleaning/quality checks, and conducting statistical analysis using linked and/or multiple data sources.



PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Data Analyst will be working directly under the supervision of Dr. Moura on various data-focused tasks including, but not limited to, data cleaning, data harmonization, data quality control, and data analysis and interpretation (e.g. multivariate regression analyses, survival analyses, etc.). The Data Analyst may also be asked to assist in conducting literature reviews, developing grant proposals, and developing presentations and manuscripts for dissemination of findings.





 SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:

The ideal candidate will have achieved strong performance in college-level statistics courses, with demonstrated strong analytic ability (including at least some experience working in SAS, STATA, R, Python, or similar programming languages). This position requires attention to detail, especially in ensuring data security, quality and accuracy. The ability to work simultaneously on various tasks, to maintain attention to detail, and to effectively contribute to the project team are also essential.



EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s Degree Required, with some background in statistics or related field.



EXPERIENCE:

At least some demonstrated experience working in SAS, SPSS, R, Python, or other programming language is required, as is a desire to learn more about data analysis.



WORKING CONDITIONS:

This is an onsite position with some flexibility to work remotely on select days.



 EEO Statement


Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.

The Role: Customer Data Analyst (Remote)
In 2021, Faethm joined Pearson, creating the world’s first truly end-to-end capability of intuitive company and employee enrichment and accelerating our cumulative mission to prepare every worker, everywhere, for the future of work and subsequent success. Our market-leading data, insights and AI capabilities will power the next generation of Pearson’s lifelong learning products to meet the rapidly changing needs of today’s workforce and bridge the global skills gap.
Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a US East Coast based Customer Data Analyst to join us on this exciting journey! We have recently joined forces with Pearson, world’s largest learning company. Operating as a scale-up within a larger company, Faethm will continue to evolve as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.
Faethm's objective is to keep every worker, everywhere, employable . Our AI-powered SaaS platform helps clients navigate the Future of Work and impact of technology on any economy, industry, organization, or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.
Faethm is building out its Customer Insights team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across the Americas. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimization, system standardization and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets, which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding, kick-off, and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.
As such, Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets:
Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems, create standardized processes, and automate our own capabilities
People with a passion for unique visualization and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment / create new content to generate value for our clients
We are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting Data Analyst to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below, but we expect this role will evolve over time. and as such, flexibility, collaboration, a passion for your work, an unquenchable thirst for knowledge, and a sense of humor will be essential.
What you’ll be doing:
You will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data, improvements to process flows, and analysis of key workforce data insights.
Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery, Product team and Sales), to understand their priorities and shifting needs.
Utilize a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical, intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.
Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process, with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform.
Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements, resolve errors, gaps, and limitations in submission files.
Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging-technology data.
Apply your analytical skillset to understand, interpret, manipulate, and visualize data (e.g., via Tableau, Excel, etc.)
Required skills & experience:
Experience in processing, cleaning, organizing and manipulating data
Programming in scripting languages such as Python
Development, enhancement and standardization of process automation and process flows, including running and understanding scripts
Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables, filtering, formulas, etc.
Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools
Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
Knowledge of AWS
Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication
Join our team in the US with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals.
We’re looking forward to discussing the role with you. Please note, due to volume of applicants and time constraints, only successful applicants will be contacted.

T1D Exchange is an innovative nonprofit organization dedicated to accelerating therapies and improving care for people with type 1 diabetes. We are rapidly expanding and have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst I professional.
 Summary:
 The Data Analyst I will work closely with the Registry, Outcomes Research teams, sponsors, and internal stakeholders to design and implement statistical analyses for qualitative, survey, and observational research, as well as to help establish and maintain best practices for data management and data analytic strategies. Develop and present statistical analysis and research plans to internal team and external stakeholders. Responsible for preparation of study documents (e.g., statistical analytic plans), reports and presentations (e.g., abstracts, manuscripts, scientific posters) to summarize research findings.
 Primary Responsibilities:

 Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 Develop statistical analysis plans for research studies and analyze data using industry-standard statistical tools, R preferred.
 Review research data to summarize population demographics, identify trends within and across studies and extrapolate other statistical inferences.
 Draft, edit, and present data analysis reports. Provide exemplary tabular and graphic summaries of analyses for presentations at internal and external meetings, scientific conferences, and in manuscript-ready formats for publications.
 Maintain working knowledge of the most recent best practices of statistical techniques and federal and state regulations
 Perform other duties as assigned (e.g., data cleaning, quality control, post-hoc analysis, interpretation of results, etc.)

 Qualifications:

 Master’s degree or higher in quantitative disciplines, such as statistics, biostatistics, epidemiology, biology, or social sciences. Exceptional applicants with Bachelor’s degree may be considered.
 Minimum one year of work experience in a similar role.
 Proficient in industry standard statistic programs such as R (preferred), SAS or SPSS for data manipulation and statistical analysis.
 Proficient in clinical and/or socio-behavioral data analysis models, such as multiple regressions, logistic regressions, and other common descriptive and inferential statistical techniques.
 Excellent problem solving and communications skills; ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees, researchers, physicians, and other professionals.
 Detail-oriented with a commitment to accurate results; works with passion, integrity, and energy. Willing to learn about new methods and technologies.
 Competent handling confidential information and familiarity with privacy/HIPAA requirements.
 Must have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced setting, working in a cross-functional environment serving diverse populations.
 Exceptional organization and time management skills with the ability to work independently and as a part of a team.

 One or more of the following qualifications considered a plus:

 Knowledge and research in diabetes.
 Experience with data wrangling involving large, complex data sets.
 Experience with industry standard visualization tools, such as Tableau.
 Experience in dealing with extraction and manipulation of relational databases (SQL).
 Experience with qualitative research methods and data analysis.
 Peer-reviewed publications or conference presentations, where you were the primary contributing author.

 More about our organization:
 T1D Exchange is an innovative nonprofit organization dedicated to accelerating therapies and improving care for people with type 1 diabetes. T1D Exchange actively supports discovery and innovation—particularly at its earliest stages. At the same time, the organization asserts that evidence gathered in the “real world” is necessary to help bridge the gap between discovery in research settings and impact in people’s lives.
 At the core of T1D Exchange research is a robust Registry of people living with type 1 diabetes, as well as cutting-edge research tools, methods, and programs to gather data and biological samples from people living with type 1 diabetes. The goal is to link patient samples, data, and insight to all stages of research and development, advancing the development of therapies and better care for everyone affected by type 1 diabetes.
 EEO Statement:
 The organization provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

Who Are We?Geode Capital Management is a leading asset manager. We meticulously manage over $1 Trillion in financial assets on behalf of our institutional clientele. Geode is disrupting the industry as a truly tech-first investment firm. We apply the latest technologies and techniques towards solving interesting and challenging problems. The technology team closely partners with each area of our business, including: portfolio management, trading, compliance, legal, operations, finance, human resources, and business development.
Why Should You Join Us?Are you looking for a linchpin role in the operations of the firm? Do you want to become an expert managing financial data sets? Geode is a business that runs on data. This is an opportunity for highly motivated individual contributors (IC) to ensure that the data driving our processes is of the highest quality possible. This is an opportunity to become an expert on the data sets we use in our investment processes. Do you want a chance to develop your skills as an analyst - build your data science skills? Do you want to create dashboards and reports for the firm, showcasing your skills? Do you want to be the firm’s go-to person for questions regarding your area of expertise? Additionally, we are re-imagining the entire tech stack, from the ground up, to meet our current needs and handle future growth demands that are quickly approaching. We want you to be part of this process of defining the operational best practices for our firm going forward. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work efforts and firm success. You will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll have a unique opportunity to solve some of the most interesting data challenges, at a scale few companies can match. As we continue to expand and create, we have a lot of exciting work ahead of us!
What Are We Looking For?As part of the Data Analysis Team, your mission is to ensure our key data assets are ready for use by the entire firm on a daily basis. We are looking for someone with an “eye for quality and details”. We want someone with the managerial skills to triage issues as they arise, intuitively to ask the right questions, and execute a corrective course of action. We are looking for someone with excellent sleuthing skills to investigate issues to uncover root causes and work with resources across the firm to continually improve the data and our processes. We are looking for someone with the research and analysis skills to become the go-to experts on data sets. We want someone that can produce metrics and other analytical reports for Portfolio Management, Trading and other stakeholders. Are you great at producing visualizations? Designing dashboards? Critical to success are strong-decision making abilities, consensus building skills, and effective communication.
Who Are You?

Love data and don’t think it’s crazy to be madly passionate about it.
Appreciates the criticality of good, clean, data, that helps drive business impact.
Team player - willingness to help with any task needed for team success
Clear communicator who can explain complex data problems in concise language.
Determined, curious, and industrious
Thrives in a fast paced environment where you roll out of bed excited to work that day.
Understands our business and sees how your work impacts the whole.

What Will You Do?

Serve as operational data steward for a set of data assets
Validate the day-to-day readiness of data assets for use in the investment process
Ask questions and look for anomalies. Identifying possible data issues is a high priority.
Be a problem solver. Triage issues and flag critical issues for escalation. Collaborate with colleagues to resolve issues.
Develop metrics, tests, reports/dashboards to evaluate and monitor data quality
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data pipelines. Identify ways to streamline our processes and automate standard maintenance.
Be curious. Develop your technical skills and expand the tool kit you use for data analysis.

BS/MS (Economics, Finance, Computer Science or related major)
Strong technical background and the ability to work independently
Experience with SQL is also preferred
Experience with various asset classes including equities, fixed-income securities, and derivatives
Solid working knowledge of Excel or more sophisticated data analysis tools (Jupyter Notebooks, Tableau, etc)
High attention to detail and supreme quality, while balancing both practicality and value-creation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Nice to Have:

Hold yourself to a high standard of work. Be responsible, open, honest, and transparent. We value your contributions and believe that when we all work together, we create a better product

Company: Boston Public Schools Office of Human Capital
Description:
Reports to: Deputy Chief Financial Officer
The BPS Finance Team ensures that the $1.1 billion operating budget is effectively allocated and managed to yield the best results for our students. We are looking to expand our capacity to manage a diverse portfolio of academic investments including schools, programs, and services. This is a unique opportunity to enter a large, urban school district and influence the way we serve our students.
The Organization
Founded in 1647, Boston Public Schools (BPS) is the oldest public school district in the country. With approximately 57,000 students from over 114 different countries, and a budget of approximately $1 billion, BPS is the largest school district in Massachusetts and is one of the most diverse as well. BPS has been recognized as one of the top urban school districts in the United States; in 2006, it was awarded the Broad Prize for Urban Education as the most improved urban school district in the nation.
General Description:
Working closely with the senior leadership of Finance, this position will provide analysis to support the development, implementation, and monitoring of the Boston Public Schools annual budget (General Funds and grant revenue); supporting the ambitious educational mission of the Boston Public Schools with finite financial resources. This individual will be provide work on projects involving financial analysis, monitoring and forecasting costs and creating financial reports and documents. This individual should be a self-starter with the ability to prioritize and execute multiple tasks and projects. This work is very collaborative, so this is a great opportunity to work closely with a group of motivated and highly competent data strategists as you advance your data analysis, visualization and presentation skills.
Required Competencies
Managing Relationships. Responds and relates well to people in all positions; is seen as a team player and is cooperative; looks for common ground and solves problems for the good of all.
Drive for Results. Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; does not give up before finishing, even in the face of resistance or setbacks; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
Functional and Technical Skills. Possesses required functional and technical knowledge and skills to do his or her job at a high level of accomplishment; demonstrates active interest and ability to enhance and apply new functional skills.
Personal Learning and Development. Is personally committed to and actively works to continuously improve himself or herself; recognizes the need to change personal, interpersonal, and managerial behavior; actively seeks feedback.
Creativity. Generates many new and unique ideas; makes connections among previously unrelated notions; is unafraid to use unorthodox methods; is seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
Managing Through Processes and Systems. Designs practices, processes, and procedures necessary to get things done; simplifies complex processes; gets more out of fewer resources; creates systems that manage themselves.
Job Responsibilities:
Leverage data and various databases to drive improvements, understand trends and create management tools for the finance department.
Respond to both immediate and longer-term requests for analysis and reporting of key departmental data, including public reporting.
Develop and implement strategies to track data requests and archive datasets.
Design and execute analyses to assess the impact of potential policy changes. Summarize key findings and recommendations in formal memos and/or presentations for internal and external audiences.
Perform any other duties as assigned by the Deputy Chief Financial Officer and/or Chief Financial Officer.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree is preferred
Excellent analytical ability. Formal training in statistics, computer science or a related field preferred
Project management skills and strong orientation toward team-work and collaboration
Strong time management skills and the ability to prioritize competing demands
Strong oral and written communication skills, particularly in translating data into easy-to-interpret, actionable reports, presentations, and findings
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally
Previous work experience in the field of education preferred but not required
Advanced mastery of Microsoft Excel required. Familiarity with other analytical software platforms such as STATA (preferred), R, Tableau, SPSS, SQL, or at least one coding language preferred
Note: This position is subject to the City of Boston residency requirement. Occasional weekend and evening work is required.

About Northeastern:

Founded in 1898, Northeastern is a global research university and the recognized leader in experience-driven lifelong learning. Our world-renowned experiential approach empowers our students, faculty, alumni, and partners to create impact far beyond the confines of discipline, degree, and campus.

Our locations—in Boston; Charlotte, North Carolina; London; Portland, Maine; San Francisco; Seattle; Silicon Valley; Toronto; Vancouver; and the Massachusetts communities of Burlington and Nahant—are nodes in our growing global university system. Through this network, we expand opportunities for flexible, student-centered learning and collaborative, solutions-focused research.

Northeastern’s comprehensive array of undergraduate and graduate programs— in a variety of on-campus and online formats—lead to degrees through the doctorate in nine colleges and schools. Among these, we offer more than 195 multi-discipline majors and degrees designed to prepare students for purposeful lives and careers.

About the Opportunity:

The Administrative Resource Center at the College of Engineering is seeking a Data Analyst. Under the supervision of the Director of Administration and Finance, the Data Analyst will partner closely with the Dean, Associate Deans and Department Chairs within the College of Engineering to ensure operational reporting needs are accurate, timely, and efficiently delivered as well as enhancing and maintaining an analytic infrastructure for all data reporting areas.

Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst will manage the division's Tableau reporting environment, custom Cognos reporting and work closely with University Decision Support and Data Administration to ensure accurate data reporting. In conjunction with the Director of Administration and Finance, the Data Analyst will serve as the college's Subject Matter Expert, providing decision support to the College of Engineering’s leadership team and data community. With regard to university data, the Data Analyst will serve on various university committees related to data standards.

In addition to developing and maintaining the colleges reporting suite, the Data Analyst will utilize data mining and analysis techniques to discover patterns and make recommendations to the college’s leadership team. They will be responsible for the college’s adhoc reporting requests including tracking the types of requests to gain insight into future standardized reporting needs. They will work closely with Business Intelligence teams and other key areas to identify key business requirements for technological enhancements, or any analytical systems/databases needs and issues.

The Data Analyst will also be responsible for all external reporting surveys including U.S. News, ASEE, and QS. This will include gathering an analyzing the data needed to respond to survey requests as well as making operation improvements to the process.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree with a focus on data analytics is preferred2–5 years of experience in a higher education setting preferredStrong analytical skills with the ability to discern key information from large data sets and make actionable recommendationsStrong Microsoft Excel skillsExperience using Cognos, Banner, Tableau Prep and Tableau to develop custom dashboardsAbility to learn new reporting systemsSQL and Python experience is a plus

 n/a

 10

Overview


As part of the Survey and Qualitative Methods Core (SQMC) at the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (DFCI) and the Dana-Farber/Harvard Cancer Center (DFHCC), the SQMC Data Analyst supports small to large scale community, health services, and implementation science research projects that use survey, qualitative, and secondary data sources. 
This position works under the supervision of the Director and Scientists of the SQMC and follows established policies and procedures in order to support the data acquisition, processing, and management needs for studies that use the SQMC services. The Data Analyst will primarily provide support for data acquisition and management for secondary data sources, which may include existing federal and state-wide surveys and electronic health records, producing reproducible data products and data visualizations. The Data Analyst will also facilitate regulatory requirements for data acquisition and management, such as institutional review board protocols and Data Use Agreements, and enrollment reporting to external and internal stakeholder, as applicable.


Responsibilities

 Analyzes secondary data (e.g. Electronic Health Records, federal and state-wide surveys).
 Retrieves and processes non-research data according to research protocol.
 Facilitates regulatory requirements for data acquisition and management. Interacts with the Institutional Review Board (IRB) for protocol submission and continuing reviews.
 Attends and contributes to research in progress meetings. 
Maintains a complete record of research activities and results in a reproducible manner.
 Performs other duties, as assigned.

 Qualifications



 Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, or quantitative health field and 1-2 years’ experience in health care or academia OR master’s degree in a health field (e.g., public health, epidemiology, biostatistics) with relevant course work. 
Experience coding in R, producing reproducible data products, and data visualizations.
 Excellent programming skills, particularly in R.
 Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work on a team.
 Good oral and written communication skills.
 Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize a variety of tasks.
 Careful attention to detail.
 Ability to demonstrate professionalism and respect for research participants’ rights and individual needs.

 About Us
Mass General Brigham Integrated Care is a system-led operating entity formed by Mass General Brigham to develop new high quality, low cost, innovative community-based ambulatory care.This work stems from Mass General Brigham’s unified system strategy to bring health care closer to patients while lowering total health care costs. MGB Integrated Care will provide a wide range of offerings, including outpatient surgery, imaging, primary care, behavioral and mental health, and specialty care, both digitally as well as at physical locations across the state and region.
We aspire to be people’s first choice for health and care
– rooted in well-being and kindness –
by bringing world-class care closer to home (or at home!) and
being the bridge to world-renowned hospitals and research when needed.
We are looking for team members who possess not only the relevant skills and growth potential, but positive attitudes, flexibility, and creative mindsets to join our expanding team. Opportunities exist for team members to contribute both in their primary domain as well as in other areas of the organization.
Our core values are shared fundamental beliefs that guide our decision-making and behavior and bind us together as a team. At MGB Integrated Care, we are:

Bravely Human: We approach our work with empathy, vulnerability, and kindness.
Clearly Honest: We seek to provide clarity amongst our teams and patients.
Proudly Collaborative: We are all part of a team - each bringing our unique talents to bear.
Intentionally Consistent: We intentionally live our purpose, providing a cohesive experience for both patients and providers.
Exceptionally Creative: We continue to learn, grow, and iterate on the ways we work.

The Opportunity: Data Analyst
Why This Role Is Important
Critical to the success of Mass General Brigham Integrated Care is our ability to analyze, understand and provide insights across the organization to support effective decision-making. To that end MGB Integrated Care is seeking a critical, collaborative thinker with a strong analytical background to fill the role of a data analyst. The data analyst will report to the Sr. Manager of Performance Management within the Integrated Care Start-up and Planning team. Additionally, the data analyst will be embedded within the Enterprise Data and Analytics scrum team dedicated to Integrated Care.
What You’ll Work On
The Data Analyst will be primarily accountable for:

Building enterprise-grade data sources and analytics (data marts, dashboards) in collaboration with Enterprise Analytics scrum team (product manager, data architects, data engineers, Tableau developers, and scrum masters)
Developing metrics, analyzing and interpreting data, and validating products
Designing reports, identifying trends, and generating insights for stakeholders
Completing ad hoc data requests in support of Integrated Care operations

In addition, the data analyst will:

Work with a variety of tools (e.g., SAS, SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.) to access data, write queries, develop programming logic, create dashboards, and conduct statistical analysis
Work with multiple sources of healthcare data (e.g., claims, financial, and clinical data) to meet both reporting requirements and support new initiatives
Retrieve, organize, and manipulate data from Epic Clarity, the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), and other databases. This will require basic programming to prepare data for reporting and analysis

EF Ultimate Break inspires young adults to participate in life-changing travel experiences across the globe. EF Ultimate Break is a division of EF Education First and is the easiest way to travel abroad for anyone 18-29 years old. Every trip gives travelers the chance to make friends, explore new places, and immerse themselves in different cultures – on fun, affordable, life-changing adventures.
This position is part of both Ultimate Break’s Marketing and Data Analytics teams and will be responsible for actioning our collected marketing data to help the business measure, understand, and predict user behavior and market trends.
You should be an energetic, curious, and collaborative person who is interested in proactively driving results through data and is excited about working in a fast-paced e-commerce environment. This role will leverage data across a variety of internal and external sources to evaluate our marketing performance and generate actionable insights and recommendations. You will also assist in ad-hoc marketing analysis requests including understanding site visitor behavior, identifying ‘customer pain points’ and measuring the impact of promotions and merchandising decisions. The ideal candidate must have a solid analytics background, be able to deliver actionable insights with high accuracy and have a strong sense of urgency.
What you’ll do:
Leverage data from our website, paid media platforms, Salesforce, email marketing tools, Google Analytics, Mixpanel and internal systems to understand the performance of our customer funnel and provide a complete picture of our marketing programs
Analyze historical and trending KPIs to understand seasonality of our business and provide recommendations around promotional cadences
Measure the efficacy of promotions and site initiatives across a variety of marketing channels (organic social media, brand campaigns, email, organic search, and paid social) and compile recommendations, learnings, and opportunities
Monitor operational metrics and set up self-service reporting and alerting to ensure the marketing team can stay on top of site performance 24/7 and be proactive with opportunities
Dig into critical marketing metrics to understand why they are moving up or down – and what we should do about it
Partner with the marketing team to set goals, measure results, uncover insights, and make recommendations
Participate in analytics code reviews and assist with broader analytics projects across the business
Who you are:
Strong understanding of marketing ecosystems and related channels (e.g., Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, etc.)
Knowledge of digital data collection best practices. Exposure to Google Analytics, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Mixpanel and/or a customer data platform preferred
Strong command of modern data visualization tools with at least 1 year of professional experience using Tableau
Solid understanding of querying, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets using SQL; experience doing similar operations in Snowflake preferred
Data-driven mindset with focus on real-time performance optimization and an ability to organize and scrutinize data, interpret metrics, and identify trends
Proficiency in basic statistics; bonus points for predictive modeling experience with Python
Excellent communication skills: ability to work collaboratively, synthesize data and present actionable insights to cross-functional stakeholders
2-4 years of experience working in an analytics or engineering capacity with multiple stakeholders
Bachelor’s or master’s degree preferred; bonus points for a background in math, computer science, engineering or experience working in a similar field
Why you’ll love working here:

Work in our beautiful Cambridge office where you’ll enjoy comprehensive professional development, frequent social programming and employee-run social groups (including our “EFinity” groups: Black@EF, LGBTQ+@EF, Latinos@EF, API@EF, Jewish@EF, Indigenous@EF and Parents@EF).

You can expect:
Eligibility for our Workplace Flexibility Program: our pilot hybrid work model with up to two days of work-from-home per week, after your initial onboarding
Robust professional growth opportunities including monthly trainings, workshops, and inspiring talks with global leaders and experts
Three weeks paid vacation your first year (four weeks starting in year two) and nine paid holidays
25% company match on your 401(k)
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage, along with life and disability insurance
Paid international business travel
Wellness benefits and a yearly fitness reimbursement
EF program discounts including travel, language schools, childcare, and more
Dependent care, healthcare, and commuter flexible spending accounts (FSAs)
Discounts at local venues and businesses

At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, identity, parental status, experience and everything else that makes you unique.
Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://ef.com.

Position: Data Science Analyst, Advanced Analytics - Full Time (Summer...
Description:
Join a team of scientists, analysts, product managers, and engineers leveraging ML and economic models to delight customers, grow the marketplace opportunity for suppliers, and unlock profit improvement for Wayfair. You will do this by improving our customer experience, shipping items quickly and economically to our customer, and providing compelling performance improvement recommendations to suppliers. Your software products will be responsible for creating the Cost and Profit estimates that power all of our customer touchpoints, from Marketing, Sort and Recommendations, to Pricing in one of the fastest growing e-commerce marketplaces in the world. You will leverage continuous experimentation, a modern tech stack, best-in-class modeling approaches, and economic theory to build a scalable, dynamic, and flexible platform.

We are looking for a highly motivated and solution-oriented Data Science Analyst to join our Product Analytics team. The team leverages Wayfair’s huge datasets to inform the roadmap of our pricing strategy. We work in close collaboration with a high performing team of engineers, machine learning engineers/data scientists/economists, and product managers who are on the leading edge of the product pricing space.

What You Will Do

Run open-ended exploratory data analysis and lightweight modeling to identify new ideas and opportunities
Proactively monitor our cost and profitability models to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve issues.
Build new tools that allow us to assess product performance.
Perform simulations and experimentations to prove out efficacy of data product/feature enhancements
Work closely and build productive relationships with our product, engineering, machine learning, and economist partners.


What You Will Need

Master’s degree earned by date of hire, preferably in a quantitative discipline (computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics)
Proficiency with SQL and in a structured programming language such as Python/R (aggregate functions, query optimization, stored procedures, string parsing, Vertica/Hive/Presto/Spark, etc.)

Since the beginning, TechTarget’s problem-solving content has risen to the top of enterprise tech buyers’ Google searches. Today it spans more than 10,000 specific topics. Our readers’ content consumption patterns provide the raw material for unique insights into their business needs. And because they find value in what we publish, they give us permission to share the data with our vendor clients.Through two decades of optimization, we’ve learned how to grow buyer interest and influence purchase decisions. We’ve got fingers on the pulse of over 200 target markets, and since we have first-hand knowledge about tech marketing and sales, we can provide the best available guidance for practitioners around the globe.TechTarget is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Data Analytics team. The person coming into this role will work on both reporting and analytics initiatives. They will build out and maintain reports for the business related to email marketing and branding, web traffic, purchase intent and account based marketing and work to ensure the overall integrity of the data going into the reports. They will also proactively work to identify opportunities to automate and streamline regular requests and report production and collaborate with other Analysts on the team to provide strategic analysis for business stakeholders and assist with data work related to implementation of advanced analytics to optimize business processes.Essential Job Functions:

Create dashboards, scorecards, and reports in Tableau and GoodData;
Provide standard and custom data analysis to core business stakeholders;
Work with other members of the team on report automation and the overall data plan to support future reporting needs;
Provide new user training and documentation of standard reporting and day-to-day support for the reports the team is responsible for; and
Develop in-depth knowledge of TechTarget’s products/services.

Knowledge, skills and abilities required: 

Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related.
1-2 years’ work experience in analytics and reporting;
Demonstrated ability to analyze and communicate findings in non-technical terms;
Understanding and experience with SQL and relational databases.
Experience in Oracle SQL and PL/SQL a plus.
Strong interest in developing skills in the field of business intelligence, machine learning and advanced analytics
Innovative, curious, with strong problem solving skills.
Ability to quickly grasp technical concepts.
Python and data science experience preferred.
Must be able to work in the US without the need for sponsorship at any time.
This position can be done remotely. (LI#-Remote)
