POSITION SUMMARY:


Under the supervision of the Director of Research Operations, the Research Data Analyst supports the work of the research team by analyzing large amounts of data, supplying statistical information, managing data and providing technical support to help the department allocate resources, measure performance, and help design new programs, facilities and systems. General research support may also include: training team members in agreed upon methods and summarizing results in text, graphs and tables; assisting in planning, conducting and analyzing surveys and designing experiments; and conducting literature searches. May also assist in the preparation of manuscripts, proposals, reports and presentation materials for meetings.

Position: Data Analyst


Department: Emergency Medicine Research


Schedule: Full Time


SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Plan and conduct statistical analyses; apply mathematical and statistical techniques and principles (including multivariable regression, hypothesis testing, generalized linear models, longitudinal analyses, mixed effects modeling, hierarchical variance structures, inter-rater reliability and agreement, approaches to multiple comparison adjustments, etc.).
Gather and interpret data requirements and translate the data requirements into report queries.
Write custom scripts and software programs, using statistical programming languages (e.g. SAS, R) to aid in data analysis and management, as needed.
Perform complex statistical analysis of data using Stata, SAS, or clinical analysis software programs for the analysis of health-related and hospital data, drawing analytical conclusions.
Summarize data into usable formats (i.e. text, graphs, and tables) for PowerPoint presentation and communicate results.
Prepare written reports of statistical analyses, including relevant statistical theory, references, methods, results and conclusions.
Provide analytic support and guidance for investigators and team members. Conduct literature and other searches.
Help to develop protocols and benchmarks for research projects. Assist in the preparation of grant proposals and IRB applications, gathering data to support the request (i.e, how the sample size will be calculated, randomization procedures to be used, etc).
Manage projects (tracking IRB and abstract submissions, compliance with data use agreements, grant requirements, and project timelines).
Assist in the drafting of manuscripts, scientific articles and publications, including writing about methodologies and statistical analysis of results; creating charts and graphs, and presenting supporting data.
Assist with identifying other funding opportunities. Troubleshoot and perform regular data audits to ensure and to improve data integrity; investigate and resolve data discrepancies. Continually monitors and maintains the applications and programs for upgrades and enhancements, providing recommendations to the program director. All other duties as requested.
Ability to work independently and to set priorities while managing several projects for several PIs simultaneously; strong attention to detail is essential.

EDUCATION:

Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics or a related field is required.
Experience in statistical programming, ( preferably with STATA; SAS and/or R ) is required.
Experience with NVivo is preferred
Experience analyzing health-related data, such as from medical records, surveys, or health care data is preferred.

CERTIFICATES:

None

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Proficiency with MS Suite (Excel /Minitab /Visio /Access/Word /Outlook/PowerPoint) also required.
Must have experience in statistical analysis and interpreting data from analytic studies.
Experience interacting with database environments (e.g. SQL, MS Access, Oracle) is a plus.
Strong conceptual and analytical skills; able to interpret and apply statistical techniques, and effective communication skills to explain methods and findings to non-statistician team members and audiences.
